loans.name: Lutfi

texts.en:
Lutfi, 38, is married and has three children between the ages of 3 and 9. Currently, two of them go to school. Lutfi works as policeman with a very low salary and is the main income source for his family. 
During the rainy season and wintertime, they have a serious problem with their house. The windows and doors leak and are not insulated properly. For a long time he could not do the necessary renovation to his home. 
Now Lutfi is requesting a loan for 800 euros to buy new doors and windows and to renovate another room to enjoy. 
This loan will improve the living conditions for his family and help to keep them healthy and warm in the upcoming winter season. 
In the future he hopes for better days. His goal is to give children a better education.

Lufti and his family are grateful to Kiva lenders for improving their living conditions!

loans.use: to buy new doors, windows and to repair the room.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha is a fighter. Despite having gone through many difficult situations, she has struggled to get ahead and maintain her family business with her husband. She is a mother of one grown child. She buys and sells goats at the market. This business is very positive for her since it has enabled her to educate her son, who graduated. Tabitha is asking for a loan with which she can buy more goats for resale. She is a very positive woman who has made her way, thanks to her hard work. She hopes to construct a permanent residence soon.

loans.use: to buy more goats for resale.

loans.name: Mamia

texts.en:
Mamie, 28, is a single parent who lives in Paynesville South, Liberia, with her son, who is 10 years old and is in school. For the past six years, she has been selling used clothing in the market. She sells men's trousers, ladies' blouses, and men's belts. She started this business with a little amount that she received from her friend. Some difficulties she faces is low sales during the raining season. She makes profit when she sells, especially during the charisma season where her sales are very high.  She uses the profit to buy more goods and to help her husband with the expenses of the home. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothing for the business.

Her plan for the future is to give her son a higher level of education and build a decent house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing for the business.

loans.name: Lumiere Group

texts.fr: Florida est entrepreneur, âgée d'environ 35 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants. Tous ses enfants étudient . Son mari est cultivateur. Elle vend des cannes à sucre. Elle commença son business avec le crédit de base de l’IMF Hekima. Elle est au 12 cycle de crédit. Elle installe ses produits à son domicile (vente en gros et détail). Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 1 tonne de canne à sucre en provenance du territoire de Rutshuru. Le défi majeur de ses affaires est dû à l’insécurité dans ce dit territoire qui est occupée par la rébellion de M23 et autres forces négatives.  En plus, elle ambitionne acheter une parcelle pour sa famille et voir ses enfants finir les études. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes non bancables.
texts.en:
Florida, age 35, is an entrepreneur and married mother of seven children who all go to school. Her husband is a farmer. 
Florida sells sugar cane. She started her business with a basic loan from the Hekima MFI, and this is her 12th loan cycle. She conducts her sales from her home, wholesale and retail. 

This new loan will help her to buy one ton of sugar cane from the Rutshuru region. Her main challenge is the lack of political stability in the Rutshuru territory, which is under occupation by M23 rebels and other subversive elements. 

She plans to buy a plot of land for her family and to help her children finish their studies. 

Florida wishes to thank the Hekima MFI for helping impoverished women who do not have access to traditional banking channels.

loans.use: to buy one ton of sugar cane.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Antonia, ella pertenece al banco “LUZ DEL SUR” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia continúa con su comercio en la  venta de accesorios de cocina como hornillas y llaves de cocina. Antonia en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería y capitalizar de esta manera su comercio.
Antonia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle fortalecerse en su actividad económica.
texts.en: Antonia is a member of the “Luz del Sur” (Southern Light) communal bank located in the city of Cusco, Peru.  She continues selling stove parts like grates and knobs.  On this occasion, Antonia needs the loan to buy merchandise to capitalize her business this way.  She’s very grateful to Kiva for making it possible for her to strengthen her economic activity.

loans.use: to buy stove accessories like grates and knobs.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married lady of forty years. She has three children who are all in school. Her business is recycling paper and polyethylene. She has been doing this business for ten years now and gets a monthly income of 12,000 KES.

This will be Jane's second loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy paper and polyethylene for her recycling business. In future she wants to feed her family well and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her recycling business

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Ms. Abida is a 48-year-old married woman who has been running a mall shop (laces, buttons and zips) for many years.  She offers different designs of laces in almost every color.  She is famous for providing good quality laces and buttons in her community.  

She is contentedly doing it for the sake of her family.  Her husband is not in good physical shape to be employed.  She is responsible for providing for her family and is trying hard to fulfill their demands including food, health, clothing, and education.  She is also sewing as her part-time job.  In this way she is able to handle her family needs and requirements effectively.  

Due to low cash in hand she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy more stocks of laces and packs of buttons in different colors in order to increase her sales.  She wishes to utilize profits on her family’s well-being.  She is thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of laces and packs of buttons for her shop.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir is a 40-year-old married man and father of two children. He has been working in the food business for 20 years. In 1995 he opened his own restaurant and since that time he is working hard on improving and developing it.

Samir's restaurant is located on the main road where anyone can pass by and experience his makings.

Samir is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy two power generators necessary for his business and family living. The first one will be used at his restaurant to keep everything fresh and healthy, to keep the electricity available for the customers, and to make his work easier.
The other one will be settled at home, for his family's benefit. It would enable them to live a normal living that anyone must have, since electricity is currently a problem with no solution in Lebanon.

Samir hopes to move to a wider shop in the future which will help him work easier and faster and increase his production.

loans.use: To buy a power generator for his restaurant and one for his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu, 22, is married and has a son. She lives in the town of Samburu, Kenya. Mbeyu has her own source of income. Three years ago she started a home-based business selling food, and as an additional source of income she sells coconuts. Mbeyu vends half-cakes, dumplings, and other foods, which she sells to the neighborhood.

She’s had two Yehu loans that have helped her to keep her business stable. She will use her current 10,000 KES loan to buy ingredients like wheat flour, baking powder, food flavors, etc. She hopes her business will be more profitable and that she will be able to stay in business. Her goal is to work hard to have a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like wheat flour, baking powder, food flavors, etc.

loans.name: Panales No 2 Group

texts.es: El banco comunal Panales No 2 esta conformado por 8 integrantes de los cuales 7 son mujeres, y un hombre. Estos integrantes sus edades comprendidas entre los 25 y 55 anos. Tienen bajo su responsabilidad 20 hijos.  Este banco   pertenece al municipio de Sauce lugar que esta ubicado en la zona norte de país. El banco comunal Panales No 2 ya ha trabajado con fundación y ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. Son personas muy trabajadoras, responsables con ganas de superación con sueños y metas. María Ofelia es la coordinadora del banco comunal Panales No 2 tiene por actividad económica la crianza y venta de cerdos para la elaboración de comidas típicas típica del país como es nacatamal, adobado, charrasca, frito. En la actualidad tiene buena clientela y ha crecido poco  a poco su negocio.  El objetivo del préstamo es invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar un lote de cerdos en pie para la crianza y venta del mismo. María Ofelia agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionista kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
The "Panales No. 2" communal bank is made up of eight members: seven women and one man. These members are aged between 25 and 55. They are responsible for 20 children. 

This group members live in the municipality of Sauce, a place located in the northern part of the country. The "Panales No. 2" communal bank has already worked with the Foundation and demonstrated its responsibility by making payments in a timely way.

They are hard-working, responsible people, with the desire to improve themselves and achieve their dreams and goals. 

Maria Ofelia is the coordinator of the "Panales No. 2" communal bank, and her work is raising and selling pigs for the making of traditional meals of the country, such as nacatamales (Nicaraguan steamed corn cakes), adobado (pork in a spicy sauce), charrasca (fried pork skin) and deep-fried snacks. Currently she has a good clientele, and her business has grown little by little. 

The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and to buy a number of pigs to raise and sell. Maria Ofelia is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders are providing to low-income people and to poor countries like Nicaragua, so that people can have a decent livelihood.

loans.use: To buy a number of pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.es: La Sra. Cinthia tiene 30 años y un hijo de 13 años,  se dedica a la venta de variedad de artículos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio que se encuentra en la misma zona donde vive,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Cinthia va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de productos para surtir su negocio como abarrotes y refrescos  y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Cinthia va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener un almacén y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra. Cinthia es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada con la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Cinthia, 30, has a 13-year-old son.  She sells a variety of basic staples in her grocery store located in the same neighborhood where she lives.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Cinthia will use it to buy a variety of products like groceries and soft-drinks to stock her store and provide greater variety for her customers.  Her reason for requesting the loan is to continue improving the business.

Cinthia will use profits to continue buying products and improving her income.  Her wish for the business is to have a warehouse to provide better customer service.  Cinthia is a very hardworking woman who is happy for the opportunity provided by this granted loan.

loans.use: to buy groceries and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Dúo Perlas  De Ramirez Group

texts.es:
DUO PERLAS DE RAMIREZ
EL DUO ESTA COMPUESTO POR LA SOCIAS SANDRA PATRICIA DE 27 AÑOS DE EDAD ES CASADA TIENE DOS HIJOS LOS CUALES ASISTEN A LA ESCUELA  EL CREDITO LO VA A UTILIZAR PARA SURTIR SU TIENDA COMPRANDO ARTICULOS DE PRIMERA NECESIDAD  Y LE DA GRACIAS A DIOS Y FAPE POR LA OPORTUNIDAD BRINDADA Y QUE LE DIERO EN EL PRIMER CREDITO Y LE PIDE A FAPE LA PUEDA SEGUIR APOYANDO CON SU NUEVO CREDITO  LO QUE MAS LES GUSTA ES  LA FORMA DE PAGO Y LOS INTERES QUE COBRAN
texts.en:
Perlas de Ramírez Duo

Sandra Patricia, 27, is married and has two children attending school.  She will use the loan to stock her store.  She will buy basic staples.  She thanks God and Fape for the opportunity they gave her with her first loan and she asks Fape to continue supporting her with her new loan.  What she likes best is the payment method and the interest rate they charge.

loans.use: to buy basic staples.

loans.name: Carolina Enriqueta

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y galletas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y galletas al por mayor.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y de este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en: She continues in the grocery business.  She sells basic staples like rice, sugar, milk and cookies.  She works from 8am until 10pm.  She’s been in this business for 8 years now and does very well.  Her dream is to expand the grocery store business.  She’s requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies at wholesale.  She values and is infinitely grateful for the loan she will be granted so that she will be able to improve her quality of life.  She likewise commits to make her installment payments in the timeframe as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies at wholesale.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 25-year-old, single man. He has worked in agriculture for 10 years. Hasan grows grains and vegetables and sells them in the wholesale market.

Hasan is working on improving his business, so he has applied for a youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a vehicle necessary for his business--in order to transport his production to a wider zone and expand his market.

Hasan inherited this business from his father--due to the lack of employment opportunities in the region, he found himself stuck in it. For this reason, he is working hard on improving, developing and expanding it as much as he can to make it suitable for fulfilling his dreams. He is planning to buy water pumps to start agricultural irrigating programs in the future that will expand his working zone.

loans.use: To buy a vehicle necessary for his business

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Micheal is twenty-nine years old. A married man with six children, he owns a general shop in Muchatha market in Kiambu town. He has been in the business for four years now and gets a monthly income of thirty-three thousand shillings.

This will be his second loan from KADET Ltd. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase more goods like rice, sugar etc for resale and a deep freezer for his business. He will use the anticipated profit and build rental houses. 

In future he wants to build his own house and live a better life.

loans.use: To add a stock of sugar, maize flour, cereals and cooking oil.

loans.name: Salata

texts.en:
Ms Salata is 28-year-old married woman and a mother of three. She has been in the business of selling cloth for two years with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Salata’s husband. Her husband assists her in selling it on the local market. He has many contacts and gained popularity among his customers. Salata serves well in her community by providing good quality cloth.
 
They need to buy more varieties of cloth for display, so Salata requested a loan of PKR 15,000, this will help her to increase her sales. She is hopeful that she will earn more profits and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of her business and on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: To buy more varieties of cloth for display.

loans.name: Naziran

texts.en: Ms Naziran is 48 years old and a hardworking woman. Two years ago she began stitching work in her house. She faced a difficult time after her husband's business failure. Her husband is a brain tumor patient. She decided to work to support her family for a better future. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is married and provides for four children. She is currently in her first loan cycle and has borrowed PKR 20,000 from Kashf. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw material, including cloth, threads of different colors, laces, zips, etc., to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She desires to spend the part of income on her husband’s health.

loans.use: To buy raw material including cloth, threads of different colors, laces, zips, etc.

loans.name: Afrim

texts.en:
Afrim, 29 years old, is a married male living in Kosovo with his wife and two children. For the last eight years he has worked as a hairdresser in his own business that he shares with his brother. He also has another job in maintenance in a public company where he works from 8 a.m. until 4 p.m. During the hours that Afrim is at his other job, his brother runs their business. Afrim runs the business for the remaining hours and on his days off.
 
Afrim is requesting a loan to buy new chairs and do some renovations for his own business. This loan will help him to develop his business and increase the number of clients. He will use the income generated from the business to support his family. In the future, he plans to develop his business more and to expand by opening another big salon. His goal is to save the money toward the children's education.

He is very happy for this opportunity and wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy new chairs and renovate his business

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,el tiene un taxi donde hace servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles de la ciudad del Cusco,el socio trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,el socio se dedica a este negocio 7 años y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es comprarse un carro nuevo.El socio solicita el credito para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: He continues in the transportation business.  He has a taxi he provides service with throughout the streets in the city of Cusco.  He works from 5am until 10pm.  He’s been in this business for 7 years and does very well.  His dream is to buy a new car.  He requests the loan to by tires for his car.  He is grateful and values the loan granted by this means and in a similar way commits to make his installment payments in the timeframe as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al trabajo de vigilancia y tambien trabaja junto con su esposo en su carro que hace servicio de taxi,la socia en su trabajo de vigilancia trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hatsa las 2:00 p.m,por medio de su trabajo y negocio de servicio de taxi,el sueño de la socia es tener un atienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar llantas para su carro.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y de este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en: She continues working in security and also works with her husband in their car providing taxi service.  She works in security from 5am until 2pm and through her work in security and providing taxi service dreams of having a grocery store.  She requests the loan to buy tires for her car.  She values and is infinitely grateful for the loan she’s being granted for she will be able to improve her quality of life this way.  Likewise, she commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy tires for her car.

loans.name: Yoryi Wilster

texts.es: Yoryi  tiene  46 años estado civil casado tiene 2 hijos .  Yoryi empezó su negocio de elaboración de puertas y muebles en su domicilio hace tiempo, actualmente vende y realiza trabajos a ciudadelas. Su sueño es incrementar su producción y ser uno de los mayores importadores de muebles . Con el préstamo va a comprar madera y herramientas etc.
texts.en:
Yoryi is 46 years old, married, and has two children. Yoryi started his business making doors and furniture in his home, some time ago. Currently he sells furniture and does jobs in the housing developments. 

His dream is to increase his production and be one of the largest furniture exporters. With the loan, he is going to buy wood and tools, etc.

loans.use: To buy wood and tools, etc.

loans.name: Munkh-Erdene

texts.en:
Mr. Munkh-Erdene is 26 years old and lives with his parents and brother in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. Since 2011, he has worked as an electrician at a local steel mill. He is an open-minded, hard-working guy who sets great objectives for himself. However his parents are pensioners; Munkh-Erdene is the one who earns income for his family, because to live on a pension in Mongolia for month is like becoming a winner in “Survivor”. 

Currently, he lives in his parent’s old wooden house, and as an elder son in the middle of his twenties, he is planning to build his own house. As he said, in the coming two years, he is planning a wedding and to make a family. Now winter has come to Mongolia, building materials are getting cheaper than usual. The loan, Munkh-Erdene is taking will be used to buy building materials, such as: five tons of concrete, 7,500 pieces of brick, and wood for his new house, which will be built in the coming spring.

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Wilson Raul

texts.es:
WILSON RAUL tiene 33 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventnas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC CAMINANDO HACIA EL FUTURO, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO JESUS DEL GRAN PODER, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTNAS, SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS.

WILSON RAÚL se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, líquido mata maleza. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes para trabajar en los cultivos.

Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas y en Mocache. El sueño es seguir trabajando para salir adelante. En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar de todo un poco.

"Esta muy agradecido por el crédito anterior que le ha servido mucho para la anterior siembra".
texts.en:
Wilson Raul is 33 years old, married with two children.  He lives with his wife and children in the city of Ventnas, in the province of Los Rios. 

He is a member of the "VRC Caminando Hacia el Futuro” [Heading towards the Future] bank group, which is located in a development site called "Jesus el gran Poder" [Jesus our Savior] located within Ventanas, which is dedicated to agricultural work. 

Wilson Raul is engaged in agricultural worker planting corn.  He is requesting this loan to buy insecticides, fertilizer and anti-weed liquid.  With the help of this loan, he can buy the fertilizer to work the crops.

He will make his purchases ​​in the cities of Ventanas and Mocache. His dream is to keep working to get ahead. In his free time, he likes to do a little of everything.

"I am very grateful for the previous loan which was very helpful for the previous crops".

loans.use: to buy insecticides, fertilizer, anti-weed liquid

loans.name: Celso Noel

texts.es:
Celso, solicita un préstamo para la compra de repuestos para el taller de bicicletas, llaves, llantas, tubos, parrillas, bombas, entre otros accesorios que son de utilidad para que Celso pueda seguir brindando un buen servicio a los clientes, el ha logrado a través de los préstamo mantener el taller surtido de buenos repuestos, hasta el momento ha tenido una buena demanda.

Celso comenta que con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, permitiendo tener mejor capacidad, sus circunstancias familiares han mejorado a través de sus aportes económicos.
texts.en:
Celso is applying for a loan to buy parts for his bicycle shop, such as locks, tires, inner tubes, racks, pumps, and other useful accessories, so that Celso can continue offering good service to customers. 

By means of the loans, he has managed to keep his shop supplied with good parts, and so far has had good demand. Celso says that the previous loans had a positive effect, allowing him to have better capacity. His family circumstances have improved through his financial contributions.

loans.use: To buy bicycle locks, tires, inner tubes, racks and pumps.

loans.name: Alonso

texts.es:
Alonso tiene 40 años, se describe como una persona trabajadora, responsable en sus actividades, su caracter es normal. Alonso vive en Otavalo con su esposa y su hijo.

Alonso y su esposa se dedican a la siembra de frutilla, actualmente tiene un sembrío al partir con un socio, en este negocio le va muy bien ya que la frutilla en este medio es muy cotizada y su producción es buena, Alonso necesita tener mayores ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, por lo cual necesita un crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de plantas de frutilla, plástico, abonos, fungicidas para sembrar  en su terreno, esta inversión ayudará a Alonso a obtener ventas e ingresos propias sin necesidad de partir al socio y esto generará mayores ingresos y mejorará la economía de su hogar.

Alonso sueña en tener un terreno grande para poder sembrar más productos y ser un comerciante mayorista.
texts.en:
Alonso, 40, describes himself as a hardworking person who is responsible with his activities.  He has a normal personality.  He lives in Otavalo with his wife and son.

Alonso and his wife grow strawberries.  He currently has a crop together with a partner.  He does well in this business because strawberries are well-priced and his production is god.  

Alonso needs to earn higher income to improve his family’s quality of life which is why he needs a loan to invest in strawberry plants, plastic, manure and fungicide to plant in his land.  This investment will help Alonso have sales and income of his own without having to work with a partner; this will generate higher income and improve his home economy.  Alonso dreams with having a large parcel of land to plant more products and become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy strawberry plants, plastic, manure and fungicide.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, se le presento la necesidad de invertir más en su negocio, es por eso que está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para el mantenimiento de su molino,comprara discos nuevos y afilara los que tiene usando, tambien comprara tolvas y bandejas,  esto le permitirá seguir con su negocio brindándoles una mejor atención a sus clientes.
Ella  comenta que el crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar el molino más para prestar el servicio de moler nixtamal a una mayor clientela y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, ella sigue con su negocio y mejorando junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Elizabeth needs to invest more in her business which is why she’s requesting a new loan to service her mill.  She will buy new disks and sharpen the ones she’s been using; she will also buy hoppers and trays.  This will allow her to stay in business providing better customer service.

She comments that the previous loan helped her to improve her mill more to provide corn milling service to more customers and improve her income.  She continues with her business and improving alongside her family.

loans.use: to buy and maintain her corn mill's disks.

loans.name: Maria Stella

texts.es:
María, necesita fortalecer su negocio, es por eso que solicita un nuevo préstamo que le ayudara en la compra de tomates, chiles, cebolla, papas, güisquiles, jilotes, zanahoria y todo tipo de verdura para surtir su venta ya que esta es demandada por sus clientes.
Ella comenta que a trabajado muy bien con estos créditos, le han ayudado a mejorar y a surtir su negocio para el mantenimiento de su familia, su situación familiar sigue igual que antes pero con mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
María needs to strengthen her business which is why she’s requesting a new loan that will help her buy tomatoes, chilies, onions, potatoes, chayote, corn on the cob, carrots and all types of vegetables to stock her business since this is what her customers are asking for.

She comments that she’s worked very well with these loans; they have helped her improve and stock her business to support her family.  Her family situation is the same as it was before but now with better income.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, chilies, onions, potatoes, chayotes and corn on the cob.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: For the last ten years, Rose has been an active merchant who is very hardworking. She is a married woman of five children and lives with her family in the Coastal region of Kenya.  Rose is an honest and kind woman who is well known for being God fearing. She sells her fruits and vegetables wholesale, selling to the small retailers.  In the past few weeks, demand for more fruits and vegetables has risen and she does not wants to disappoint her customers.  With this loan Rose is requesting from Yehu, she will purchase tomatoes, cabbages, potatoes, bananas, and other fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 32-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa in Jordan. She has four children and requested a 600 JOD loan to pay for retailing in clothes. 

In the future, Nadia is looking forward to improving the financial and living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for retailing in clothes.

loans.name: Happy

texts.en:
Happy, 19, lives with her life partner. She is still childless. 

She sells fruits and vegetables: brinjals (eggplant), tomatoes, onions, cabbages, oranges, and others. She has been a merchant for three years and has gained the sales experience necessary to increase her profits. Her stall is in the market in her neighborhood. She has regular customers because she is well-known. 

Happy is active, dedicated to her work, and has many goals. She works very hard each day to reach these goals and, thereby, achieve success. Like every good merchant, she wants to grow her business and make new investments. She needs capital to do so and has applied for a loan with Yehu to buy more fruits and vegetables. 

Happy has good credit references and is very responsible. She is certain she will repay the loan while giving her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Yesin

texts.en:
Yesin is a 43-year-old married man and father of three children. He opened a poultry shop in 2003.

Yesin works hard to improve his business selling chicken and its affiliates. He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, for the second time, in order to increase his business capital through increasing his stock of chicken which will allow him to sell more. His first loan was requested to pay for his brother's medical surgery which had a positive feedback. 

Yesin hopes to expand his business to keep on providing a healthy living for his family. He hopes to keep on expanding his his business as much as he can to improve his living.

loans.use: To increase his working capital through increasing his stock of chicken.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a man of thirty-five. Married to Alice and a father of two, he runs a motorbike transport business and also wants to start a photo studio jointly with one of his friends. He has been taking photos from door-to-door for two years now and gets a monthly income of thirty thousand Kenya Shillings.

This will be Paul's second loan with KADET Ltd., he plans to use the entire loan to open a photo studio. In future he wants to be a successful business man.

loans.use: To open a studio .

loans.name: Jose Bernardo

texts.es: José  tiene 45 años estado civil casado, no tiene hijos. José cuenta que raíz que lo despidieron de su ex empleo el trato de conseguir un empleo nuevo pero nadie le abrió las puertas, Por lo que el trato de salir adelante en esta vida poniéndose un negocio de comidas rápidas. José vende meriendas .Con el préstamo el quiere comprar:arroz, menestra y arreglar su local etc.
texts.en: José, 45, is married and has no children.  José relates that when he was let go from his former job he tried to get a new job but no one opened their door for him which was why he tried to get ahead in life by setting up a fast-food business.  José sells lunches.  He wants to use the loan to buy rice, vegetables and to fix up his locale.

loans.use: to buy rice and vegetables and to fix up his locale.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa Amelia vive en el municipio de El Sauce, ubicado al occidente del departamento de León, es una señora de 43 años, soltera, con tres hijos, todos estudiando, de los cuales solamente una trabaja actualmente.
 Gracias a su labor que desempeña como conserje desde hace 6 años ha logrado mejorar su vivienda en cuanto a las condiciones, sus hijos están logrando prepararse profesionalmente a los cuales les ha inculcado buenos principios y hoy son personas de bien, luchadores al igual que su madre, la cual los educó sola sin la ayuda de su padre.

Está solicitando un crédito para la compra de ladrillos, cemento y pago de mano de obra con el fin de cambiar otra pared de dicha vivienda

Gracias a estos créditos ha ido mejorando su vivienda ya que antes todas las paredes eran de barro lo que significaba un peligro para su familia y por tal razón agradece a KIVA y Ceprodel porque le ha permitido ir poco a poco cambiando las condiciones de vida lo que no hubiera podido llevar a cabo con su bajo salario.
texts.en:
Rosa Amelia lives in El Sauce located in León Department.  She’s 43-years-old, single and has three children; all attend school and only one of them currently works.

Thanks to the caretaker job she’s had for the last 6 years she’s managed to improve her house’s conditions.  Her children are preparing themselves professionally and she’s instilled good principles in them and today they are upstanding citizens who are tenacious just like their mother; she raised them alone without help from their father.

She’s requesting the loan to buy bricks, cement and to pay labor costs to replace another wall in said house.  Thanks to these loans she’s been improving her house because all the walls used to be mud which represented a great danger for her family and because of this she’s grateful to Kiva and Ceprodel because they’ve made it possible for her to gradually change her living conditions which she never would have been able to accomplish with her low salary.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is a 28-year-old married man and a father of one child. Mahdi has been working in the transportation business for 14 years. 

Mahdi started working early to help his parents in making their living. He couldn't finish his intermediate studies, but he insists on providing the best education for his child. That's why he is working hard on improving his business to increase his income and respond to his family's needs.

Mahdi applied for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary diesel and wood, in addition to carpets to warm up his family in the coming autumn/winter season.

Mahdi hopes to stay in good health to keep on providing a good living to his family members.

loans.use: to buy necessary diesel and wood, in addition to carpets to warm up his family in the coming autumn/winter season

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 22 years of age, married, and has two twin children, both in school. She lives with her family in the town of Samburu, located in the Coast Province, Kenya. She has worked making fabric items and clothing, such as blouses and skirts, and making clothing repairs. 

Lilian has kept her business stable through the help of her husband who is employed, and this is her second loan with Yehu. She plans to open a poultry business. This current loan will be used to buy chicks, a brooder, and chicken feed. She hopes to have a more stable business and make more use of it, and her plan is to have family stability.

loans.use: to buy chicks, brooder, and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa, 40, lives with her spouse and their six children. She has a food stall at home where she prepares a variety of dishes like rice, baked products, beans, and beverages, among others. To add to the household income, she also sells charcoal. 

Mupa is an energetic, tenacious woman who is very dedicated to her work; she sets quite a good example. She works every day with much effort because she knows that this is the only way to attain the success she so desires.

Demand has increased in recent months and, like all good merchants, she wants to increase business and make a new investment that will allow her to buy flour, cooking oil, rice, and sugar, and also buy furniture.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, rice, and sugar, and also buy furniture.

loans.name: Caro

texts.en:
Caro is a 23-year-old single woman. She describes herself to be a self-motivated woman.  She operates a tailoring retail store  where she sells clothes. Caro also sells cereals to customers. 

She has been involved in this business for three years and employs two staff members. Her business is located at a highly populated area, and her primary customers are residents from environs. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate materials for making clothes to sell . 

She will use the KES 12,900 loan to buy a solar lamp that will used in her business. Her business goal is to diversify her business to other major towns  within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp for her business.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet, age 35, is a married mother, and she has one child. Three years ago she established her own tailoring business making and repairing clothes. She is requesting a loan to buy materials like fabric, thread, elastic, and lace in order to make clothes. This investment will help her keep her business stable, and it will help her get the income her family needs. Her goal is to always keep her business active. This is because it is her source of income to support her family. Also, she wants to feel fulfilled as a person.

loans.use: to buy materials like fabric, thread, elastic, and lace

loans.name: Erick Francisco

texts.es:
El Sauce Una bella ciudad que pertenece al departamento de León, se encuentra rodeado de muchas bellezas naturales, donde la mayoría de los clientes se dedican al comercio y otros a brindarle servicio a diferentes instituciones como es el caso del señor Erick Francisco de 31 años de edad.
   
El Señor Erick Francisco Vive con su Madre en su propia vivienda donde él se dedica a brindarle enseñanza a estudiante de dicho municipio y actualmente está pasando dificultades ya que ha comenzado a tener malas condiciones en dicha vivienda por lo que tuvo la oportunidad de recibir un crédito con Ceprodel para el mejoramiento de su vivienda. 

Se presentó por segunda vez para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como cemento, arena, y pago de mano de obra. 

Está consciente que Kiva y Ceprodel apoya a este tipo de personas y espera que dicho institución le siga otorgando crédito para así lograr sus principales sueños de vivir en mejores condiciones con su familia.
texts.en:
El Sauce is a beautiful city in León department, surrounded by much natural beauty. The majority of clients work in small businesses, and others provide services in various institutions, such as in the case of Erick Francisco, 31 years old. 

Erick Francisco lives with his mother in their own home, and teaches students who live in this municipality. Currently he is experiencing difficulties, as his home is getting to be in poor condition. Therefore he had the opportunity to receive a loan from Ceprodel to do improvements to his home.

He has come for the second time to apply for a loan with Ceprodel, in order to buy construction materials such as cement and sand, as well as pay for labor. 

He is aware that Kiva and Ceprodel are supporting these kinds of people, and hopes that this institution continues to grant credit, so that he can achieve his main dream of having better living conditions for him and his family.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Colomba

texts.es:
Colomba, necesita invertir para incrementar su venta de tortillas, es por eso que está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña y comal, esto le permitirá sostener su negocio y su alimentación para el hogar.
Ella dice que con el préstamo anterior pudo mejorar el servicio obteniendo mejores ganancias y mejorar en su clientela, ella sigue con su negocio creciendo en las ventas y con su nivel económico en su familia, espera tener las fuerzas para trabajar y ser buen cliente.
texts.en:
Colomba needs to invest in order to increase tortilla production which is why she’s asking for a new loan to buy corn, firewood and a griddle.  This will allow her to stay in business and provide food for her home.

She says that the previous loan let her improve service obtaining higher profits and increasing her clientele.  She continues with her business increasing sales and her family’s economic level; she hopes to have the strength to continue working and to be a good client.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and a griddle.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura, 44, describes herself as a responsible, very hardworking person for her family’s well-being.  Zuhura is a widow who lives with her three children in the town of Samburu located in Coast Province.

Zuhura works buying and selling vegetables and fruits, a business that allows her to cover household expenses. She is currently asking Yehu for a loan to invest in the purchase of oranges, bananas, tomatoes, cabbages, among others, which in this season is going up considerably and her income will  improve thus attaining a change in her family’s quality of life.

Zuhura dreams of having a large locale to be able to offer a greater diversity of fruits and vegetables, and also to open a cereal shop.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en: Khawla is a 45-year-old married female from Al Zarqa in Jordan.  She has 6 children.  Khawla requested a 700 JOD loan to pay for retailing in clothes.  In the future, she would like to expand her business in order to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 30-year-old married woman doing a business of hand embroidery for the past three years. Her designing is much appreciated by her customers. She works hard to diversify her livelihood as she understands that she needs to not solely depend on the income earned by her husband. Her husband works in a tuck shop and earns a low income to support his family. 

Robina has five children, all are school going. She is in charge of providing them with the basic necessities of life.  Her business has improved gradually. She needs to expand her business so she contacted Kashf Foundation for the first time.  Robina requested for a loan of Rs. 20000 to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of sequins, pearls and stones for embellishments.  This will help her to complete the orders on time according to the requirements of the customers. 

Robina is very excited about this new loan and wants to spend the portion of profits on her children’s education and for their better standard of living.

loans.use: buy embroidery supplies

loans.name: Markonee

texts.en:
Markonee, 35, is married and lives  in Paynesville South.  She is a mother of  three girls who are between the ages of 6 and 14 and are in school.  

Markonee has a cook shop (restaurant).  She has been operating this business for the past fifteen years.  She sells six days a week.  She makes more profit when she prepares cassava leaves, fufu and soup, because they are her customers' favorite dishes.  

Markonee  is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients in order to meet customer demand. She hopes to become a big business woman.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy is 50 years old, married and blessed with six children that she supports. She operates a restaurant as well as rental houses in Narok town for the past five years. Her monthly income is KES 35,000 

Sophy has applied for business a loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD.  This will facilitate in renovating and expanding her busy restaurant.  She intends to use anticipated profits to reinvest to the business. Her future dreams is to have a stable business and educate her children.

loans.use: renovate and expand her restaurant

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 50-year-old single man who has been working in fixing car's body since 2000.  Mohamad is a hard worker and well known in the region with a good reputation. 

Mohamad applied for a loan for the first time from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to  buy six painting spray guns so he can reply faster to customers needs, in a professional way as expected.  Mohamad is also talented in drawing, that's why most of his customers request special drawings to be set on their car's body upon request.

loans.use: buy six painting spray guns

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is a married woman with two children who are six and three years old. She is married to Dickson, a mechanical technician, and together they cater for their household expenses. 

Luciana has been operating a tailoring business that is home-based. She has been in this business for the last nine years, and it has provided her with good results. Thanks to her hard work, she has been able to save.  

Luciana is now requesting this loan to buy a plot of land to construct a residential house, since she currently rents the house they live in.  Her future dream is to open a dressmaking college.

loans.use: buy a piece land to build her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a tent to rent

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
Amjad, who appears in the photo, is a 31-year-old man; he is married with no children yet.

Amjad has had a shoe store for two years; it is profitable, and the only source of income for him.  However, it needs more support to cover costs.

As a feast is around the corner, Amjad is requesting a 2000 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a new collection of men, women and children's shoes to resell, and for installing a new sign for the store. This loan will provide a wide range of shoes to resell (which will satisfy his customers and increase the size of his sales), and also to create a new image for the store, attracting more customers. 

What distinguishes this project is that it is located in an area with good traffic, and has many loyal customers. Taking this loan will increase sales and improve the family's income, which will enable them to live in better conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a new collection of shoes for sale and install a new sign for his store.

loans.name: Neman's Group

texts.en:
Neman's group is made up of six women who sell consumable goods like foodstuffs, provisions, and fish. Two are into the sale of foodstuffs, three are into the sale of fish, and the other person is into the sale of provisions. Their ages range between 21 to 60 years old, and they have been together for three years.

Lydia is a 38-year-old fish seller who is married to a 42-year-old businessman; they have two children. 

She has been selling fish for 10 years. She supplies customers in Accra from Monday to Saturday and from 6 am to 6 pm. She is in her third loan cycle with ID-Ghana.

She needs a support of GHS 600 to buy more fish to supply to customers. She was loaned GHS 300 in her second loan cycle, and she successfully repaid without a problem.

She has been making enough profit to support family needs and reinvest in her job.

Lydia, together with other five, need a total amount of GHS 2,600 to be able to expand business.

loans.use: To buy fish and supply her customers.

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en:
Dorine  is a 26-year-old married woman. She has 2 children, ages 4 and 7.  She describes herself as determined and hard working. 

She operates a retail tailoring store, where she sells clothes. She has been in this business for 5 years, and employs two people. Her business is located at a residential area, and her primary customers are residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient materials for making clothes to sell. She will use the Kes 12900 loan to buy a solar lamp to be used in her house.  Her business goal is to start making wedding gowns for customers within 5 years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will be a designer of clothes that will be best selling. Dorine also farms.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp for her home.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo, 37 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 6 años, de oficio agricultor siembra frijoles y maíz, sin ningún nivel de estudio. Aprendió a trabajar con sus hermanos a la edad de 8 años en el campo, actividad que heredaron por tradición y de cual sobrevive actualmente además de criar y engordar  animales vende huevos y siembra con sus hermanos. 
Está requiriendo el financiamiento para pagar mano de obra y  comprar 5 rollos alambre para hacer una cerca y proteger sus cultivos para que el ganado no se lo coma. Su meta en lograr ampliar sus áreas de agricultura, y brindarle un mejor futuro  a su hijo.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is 37 years old and he has a 6-year-old child. He is a farmer and he plants beans and corn. He did not go to school, and he started learning how to do his job when he was 8 years old, together with his brothers. This is an activity traditionally passed down, and it currently provides him with an income; he sows his lands with his brothers, and on top of this he breeds and fattens animals, and he sells eggs.
He is requesting a loan to pay for labor costs and to buy 5 rolls of barbed wire: he wants to build a fence to protect his crops from cattle’s appetite. He aims at succeeding in expanding his farming area and in offering a better future to his son.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs and to buy 5 rolls of barbed wire.

loans.name: Mayra Yolanda

texts.es:
Mayra tiene 26 años, es una persona muy responsable, felíz, solidaria, carismática y sobre todo trabajadora con deseos de superarse para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo. Mayra vive con su hijo en San Gabriel.

Mayra y sus padres se dedican a la comercialización de leche, sus padres le enseñaron este negocio y conjuntamente con ellos ha ido aprendiendo y progresando. Mayra necesita un crédito para invertir en la compra de una vaca lechera para incrementar la producción de leche y producir queso ya que quiere emprender en el negocio de venta de leche y queso, esta inversión ayudará a Mayra a obtener más ventas, más clientes y más ingresos lo que ayudará a mejorar la economía de su hogar.

Mayra sueña en tener una finca propia donde pueda criar ganado lechero para crear fuentes de trabajo y ayudar con esto a las personas que más lo necesitan y sobre todo mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mayra, 26, is a very responsible, happy, supportive, charismatic and above all hardworking woman who very much wants to improve and provide a better quality of life for her son.  Mayra lives with her son in San Gabriel.  

Mayra and her parents are dairy farmers; they sell milk.  Her parents taught her this business and she’s been learning it and making progress alongside them.  Mayra needs a loan to buy a dairy cow to increase milk production and to make cheese because she wants to start a business selling milk and cheese.  This investment will help Mayra have more sales, more customers and more income that will help her improve family economy.

Mayra dreams with having her own farm to raise dairy cattle and to create sources of employment to help others who are most in need and above all to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es:
En Santa Rosa del Peñón, es un maravilloso pueblo, cuentan con diferentes empresas donde la mayoría de los clientes se dedican a brindarle servicio a las instituciones como es el caso de Oscar Danilo, de igual forma se dedican a la agricultura, el comercio y la ganadería.   

Oscar Danilo es nacido y criado en este bello municipio con buenos costumbre y amor al trabajo que desde muy pequeña le enseñaron a defenderse en su vida personal. 

Desempeña el cargo de responsable de Catastro en una de las instituciones de su municipio, tiene muchos años de laborar en este lugar, actualmente esta solicitando  un tercer crédito para la compra de: cemento y arena ya que él cuenta con parte de su presupuesto para realizar alguna mejora en su vivienda.   

Agradece a KIVA y Ceprodel por el apoyo con estas pequeños créditos que ayudara a mejorar sus condiciones de vida  y de la misma forma agradece por los créditos que a recibido.
texts.en:
Santa Rosa del Peñón is a marvelous town.  It has various firms  where most clients work providing services to institutions.  This is Oscar Danilo’s case.  They also work in agriculture, commerce and animal husbandry.

Oscar Danilo is born and raised in this beautiful town; he has good customs and a love for work; he was taught since he was very young to fend for himself in his personal life.

He works in the town’s property registry office and has been working here for many years.  He’s currently requesting his third loan to buy cement and sand; he already has part of the budget needed to do some home improvements.

He thanks Kiva and Ceprodel for the support these small loans provide that will help him improve his living cnditions.  He is grateful for the loans he’s received.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and lumber.

loans.name: Luz Milia

texts.es:
El Sauce es un municipio que pertenece al departamento de León, en él habita Luz Milia, una señora de 48 años, se dedica a el desempeño de maestra de educación primaria, cuenta con una hija bajo su cargo con muchos deseos de verla superar en su carrera universitaria. 

Como toda madre sueños por ver superar a sus hijos la señora Luz Milia cuenta con una hija que está cerca por concluir su carrera universitaria. 

Está solicitando un crédito para pagar los módulo de la universidad con el objetivo de no tener ningún inconveniente para que su hija llegue a obtener su título universitario. 

Está muy agradecida con KIVA y Ceprodel por este período que tiene de trabajar con ellos y que le han brindado su mano amiga con el apoyo de estos créditos que aseguran el futuro de las personas que más lo necesitan.
texts.en:
El Sauce is a city in León Department.  Luz Milia lives there. She’s a 48-year-old woman who works as an elementary school teacher.  She has a daughter in her care who she very much wants to see succeed in her university career.

Like all mothers, she dreams with her children succeeding and Luz Milia has a daughter who is about to conclude her university career.  She’s requesting this loan to pay her university course tuition so that her daughter will have no problem and will attain her degree.

She is very grateful to Kiva and to Ceprodel for this period of time she’s been working with them and in which they have extended a friendly hand with support from the loans that assure the future for those people most in need.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Arab Abudalla

texts.en:
Arab is a 40-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married, and has 5 children between the ages of 6 and 16.  All of them go to school.

Arab runs a general store, and has been in business for 5 years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 1800 SDG to purchase kejje, onions, and many other items. She has no other source of income outside this business.

In 5 years Arab would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Arab says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like kejje, onions, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Samuel Eli

texts.es:
Samuel, necesita fortalecer su cultivo existente en dos manzanas de maíz, el cual sembro hace algunos meses, es por eso que está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y asi poder fortalecer su cultivo aplicando este material en el tiempo adecuado para obtener una buena cosecha.
El comenta que gracias al préstamo anterior sus cultivos han mejorado la producion y a si mejorar también la economía y la alimentación de su familia.
texts.en:
Samuel hopes to strengthen his farming operation with the support from this loan. Just a few months ago, he planted corn on 3.5 acres of land, and plans to purchase fertilizers with the funds from this loan. He hopes that the positive impact of the fertilizer will yield a good harvest.

Samuel is grateful for his previous loan, as it allowed him to increase his corn production and generate more income to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Isaias De Jesus

texts.es:
Isaías, es habitante de la comarca Las Banderas, casado, tiene 2 hijos de 4 años y un bebe de tres meses. El se dedica a vender piedras canteras desde hace 8 años, actividad que realiza en un pequeño camión que le dejo su papa. Además tiene una pequeña pulpería donde vende productos comestibles al detalle. Con estas 2 actividades el mantiene a su familia. 
Él está solicitando el financiamiento para comprar jugos, gaseosas, galletas, sopas, enlatados, caramelos, productos de limpieza, aceite. Su negocio es pequeño pero trabaja fuerte día a día para que crezca y puede ofrecer más variedad de productos para cubrir parte de las necesidades de su clientela. Otro proyecto que tiene ir ahorrando para comprar otro camión y continuar con la venta de piedra.
texts.en:
Isaías lives in the rural area of Las Banderas, he is married and he has 2 children aged 4 and a baby aged 3 months. He has been engaged in selling quarry stones for 8 years, an activity he carries out with a small truck his father has left him. He also runs a small retail store where he sells edible products. Thanks to these 2 activities he is able to provide for his family.
He is requesting a loan to buy juice, fizzy drinks, biscuits, soups, canned foods, candies, cleaning products and oil. His shop is small but he daily works hard to make it bigger and to offer a wider variety of products to partly provide for his customers’ needs. He also has another project: he wants to keep on saving to buy another truck and to continue selling stones.

loans.use: To buy juice, fizzy drinks, biscuits, soups, canned foods, candies, cleaning products and oil.

loans.name: Luis Roberto

texts.es: Luis, tiene 54 años de edad, casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Arizona, Atlántida. El tiene 20 años aproximado de dedicarse a realizar actividades agrícolas, el tiene varias vacas de donde genera ingresos por la venta de leche, también tiene una pequeña producción de palma de allí vende la fruta que sirve para sacar aceite vegetal, y en temporada navideña compra pollo para la cría y venta de donde genera otros ingresos. Don Luis ha manejado varios prestamos con ODEF, este préstamo que solicita actualmente es el numero 8 y es por 20,000 Lempiras para invertir en la compra de pollo y concentrado para engordarlos y venderlos aprovechando esta temporada y lograr incrementar los ingresos para la manutención de su familia. Su sueño es mantener activo este negocio para heredarlo a sus hijos en un futuro.
texts.en:
Luis is 54 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in the municipality of Arizona, Atlántida. He has been farming for around 20 years. He has several cows, with which he generates income through the sale of milk. He also has a small palm plantation, and sells the fruit they produce, which is used to extract vegetable oil. As well, in the Christmas season he buys chicken to raise and sell, and generates additional income from this.

He has undertaken several loans with ODEF. The loan he is currently applying for is his eighth, and is for 20,000 lempiras. It is to invest in the purchase of chickens and concentrate, in order to fatten and sell them. With this, he will take advantage of the season and succeed in increasing his income for supporting his family. His dream is to keep his business going, so that he can pass it on to his children someday.

loans.use: To buy chickens to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 53-year-old married man and a father of five children.  Ali has raised livestock and sold their milk for the past 26 years.  He is an expert in his business and most meat dealers visit him because of the good quality they receive.  Ali is a hard worker and a man with a very good reputation.
 
Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua for the same reason as his previous loan request, to prepare his business for the autumn/winter season.  He wants to buy a large quantity of livestock food at special prices.  In addition, he wants to rent agricultural lands to cultivate with special plants.  Ali is an expert in his domain and he hopes to keep improving his business as much as he can through expanding his livestock working area.

loans.use: to buy necessary food for his livestock for the winter season.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 50 years old and married to Edward.  She has two children who are both over 18 years.  

She is a dairy farmer and has been in this business for ten years now.  She gets a monthly income of KES 40,000.

This will be Mary's fourth loan with KADET LTD.  She plans to buy a dairy cow with the money that she will get. 

In the future, she wants to be more successful in her business.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 36 years old and married, with two children.  He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. 

He has a house.  He started it with small capital and took a previous loan from bank. He is hardworking, and he plans to renovate his house. So he applied for a loan of YER 150,000 from AMB to buy construction supplies for his house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for his house.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 24 years old, married, and blessed with two children. He owns a carpentry shop, a business he started six years ago. He earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES. 

He has requested a first loan of 15,000 KES to purchase timber for use in his carpentry shop. The profit he earns will aid him in educating his children. His dream is to prosper in this business and buy a piece of land to build his own home.

loans.use: To purchase timber for use in his carpentry shop.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 28-year-old man, married to Eunice and father of two children.  

He is an electrician and also sells electrical goods.  And he does dry-cleaning in Banana in the outskirts of Kangemi. 

James has been in this business for six years and gets a monthly income of KES 50,000.

This will be his first loan with KADET LTD.  He plans to use the entire loan to buy electrical items for resale. In future he wants to expand his business and also feed his family.

loans.use: To buy electrical items like wires.

loans.name: Jose Eleuterio

texts.es: José tiene 50 años estado civil casada tiene hijos mayores de edad. José cuenta que desde pequeño trabajo en este oficio que es la fabricación de muebles por ese era el trabajo de su padre pero el ahora se independizo y tiene su propio taller: Con el préstamo José quiere comprar madera y herramientas
texts.en: José, age 50, is married and has grown children.  José says that he has been working in the trade of making furniture ever since he was little.  This was the work his father did.  However, José now works independently, and he has his own shop.  José wants to use the loan to buy wood and tools.

loans.use: to buy wood and tools.

loans.name: Nayeli Itzamara

texts.es:
Nayeli vive en un lugar de Tamaulipas, esta separada de su esposo tiene una pequeña
De 3 años trabaja en una maquiladora, actualmente en la casa donde vive tiene problemas con el agua pues no sale ya que las tuberías son muy viejas y quiere cambiarlas por lo que necesita se le apoye para este proyecto. De las tuberías de agua de su casa.
texts.en:
Nayeli lives in Tamaulipas.  She is separated from her husband, and she has a little three year old.  Nayeli works at a factory.  

She currently has problems with the water in the house where she lives.  The water does not come out because the pipes are very old.  She wants to change them.

In order to do so she needs help for this project of changing the water pipes in her house.

loans.use: to change the water pipes in her house.

loans.name: Hadir Juma

texts.en:
Hadir is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has four children between the ages of 4 and 10.  All of them go to school.

Hadir runs a general store, and she has been in business for five years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. 

She is taking a loan of SDG 1,800 to purchase clothes and many other items. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years Hadir would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Hadir says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan, through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and other items.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis es una persona alegre, muy responsable en su trabajo, emprendedor y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante para cumplir sus sueños y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Luis vive con su esposa y su hijo en la ciudad de Ibarra.

Luis trabaja con su mujer en la confección de ropa, como camisetas en tela de punto, chompas en cuero sintético, Luis se ha dedicado a este negocio 5 años y le ha ido muy bien, actualmente tiene varios clientes por lo que necesita incrementar su producción para obtener mejores ingresos y seguir adelante, decide realizar un crédito en Fodemi el mismo que invertirá en la compra de rollos  tela de punto y planchas de cuero sintético para las chompas.

Luis sueña en tener un taller adecuado para su negocio y poder incrementar personal para que su producción sea mayor y con esto mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is a cheerful person. He is very responsible with his job, he is resourceful and he has a great wish to progress in life to make his dreams come true and improve his family’s standard of living. Luis lives with his wife and their son in the town of Ibarra.

Luis works with his wife making items of clothing such as crossed-stitched T-shirts and synthetic leather jackets. Luis has been engaging in this activity for years and things have been going very well. He can currently count o many customers and for this reason he needs to increase his production in order to get a better income ant to keep on progression. For this reason he has decided to ask Fodemi for a loan to use it to buy rolls of cross-stitched cloth and synthetic leather sheets for his jackets.

Luis dreams of owning an adequate sewing workshop for his activity and to succeed in hiring more people to increase his production, in order to improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To buy rolls of cross-stitched cloth and synthetic leather sheets.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Ms. Asia is 33 years old and married. She has been working in hand embroidery for 10 years. She has been blessed with the skills of hand embroidery ever since childhood, so she utilized her skills by starting this business in order to become a helping hand for her husband. Asia’s husband is employed in a private firm and earns insufficient income to bear the everyday expenditures of his family alone. Asia is contributing a lot to the family's income. She is famous in her community for providing the best designs so the demands of her customers are increasing day-by-day. 

She lives with her husband, children and other relatives in a small house. She is responsible to provide them with good quality food and an education to her children. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Now she requested a loan of 40000 PKR to buy reels of threads in different colors with packs of pearls, sequins and needles. She desires to spend the portion of her profit on the improvement of her house and her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors with packs of pearls, sequins and needles.

loans.name: Salman

texts.en:
Salman is a 37-year-old man, living in an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) Settlement with his wife and four children. He raises cows for milk purposes and has four years of experience in this field.  His business brings him a stable income of 250 AZN.   He has permanent buyers, however, there is only one problem he has now, which is absence of water.  Now, in order to water his cows, he has to herd them about 1 kilometer to the nearest river. 

When he heard about water loans he was extremely excited and applied for a 2000 AZN loan. A water channel is quite an expensive process which requires a labor force and special equipment.  Salman will use this loan to pay for special equipment rental like a tractor for making a water channel and for workers who will dig up the land.

loans.use: to pay for tractor rental and pay hired laborers to get water for his dairy cattle.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en: Manal is a 49-year-old married woman from Marka in Jordan. She has five children and requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses and buying some furniture. In the future she would like to improve the living conditions of her family and buy a car.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Dorfine

texts.en: At 23, Dorfine is a mother of two children. She is married to Micheal, a lecturer. Dorfine has a retail shop where she sells sports items like balls and trophies. The business is four months old and she can count good profit returns. Dorfine dreams of opening several other businesses and also constructing a residential house as she currently lives in a rental house. With the requested loan, she plans to buy more trophies and balls.

loans.use: to buy more trophies and balls.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 51 years old and married to Peter; they are blessed with six children, ages 19, 15, 13, 11, 9, and 5 years.  

She supplies milk alongside selling charcoal and maize, a business she started six years ago.  She earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

Mary has requested for a first loan of KES 10,000 to purchase milk for sale. The profit she earns will be ploughed back to her business. Her dream is to one day own a piece of land and build her house.

loans.use: To purchase milk for sale.

loans.name: Nasula

texts.en:
Nasula is 22 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past three years, Nasula has been working hard to manage her small business, where she cooks and sells local foods like posho (a hot, sticky dough made from maize or cassava) and rice. 

To help expand her business, Nasula has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more posho and rice, and will help Nasula to generate greater profits and cover the basic needs of her family. Nasula hopes that in the future she will be able to grow her business. 

Nasula is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more posho and rice.

loans.name: Paz Y Progreso Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Peru! La Sra. Fausta  es integrante de la alcancía comunal “Paz y Progreso”, un grupo conformado por 13 socias que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio.

Fausta tiene un restaurante propio donde vende desayuno almuerzos y gaseosas, Fausta inicia su negocio alquilando un restaurante, con el tiempo pudo comprar el restaurante y ahora es propio, ahora cuenta con clientes fidelizados.

Fausta ha solicitado el préstamo para ampliar su negocio y comprar mesas . Su sueño es que su negocio siga creciendo y abrir otro restaurante.

Fausta es separada y tiene 2 hijos. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación, Fausta ha logrado pagar los estudios de sus hijos en la universidad y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida. Fausta está muy contenta con este préstamo y agradece a Edaprospo y a Kiva.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru! Fausta is a member of “Paz y Progreso”(Peace and Progress), a Communal Bank composed of 13 people engaging in different retail activities.

Fausta runs her own restaurant selling breakfasts, lunches and fizzy drinks. Fausta has started her activity by renting out a restaurant; in time she has succeeded in buying the same restaurant and now it belongs to her, and she can count on recurring customers.

Fausta has requested a loan to expand her restaurant and to buy tables. She hopes that her restaurant will keep on growing and she dreams of opening another one.

Fausta is separated and she has 2 children. Thanks to her efforts and dedication, Fausta has succeeded in paying for her children’s university education and in offering them a better standard of living. Fausta is very happy about the loan and she is grateful to Edaproso and Kiva.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant and to buy tables.

loans.name: Iselem Muhamed

texts.en:
Iselem is a 36-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has four children between the ages of four and ten.  All of them go to school.

Iselem runs a clothing store and has been in business for 5 years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 1800 SDG to purchase clothing and many other items.  She has no other source of income besides this business.

In 5 years Iselem would like to expand her business.  Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Iselem says she is happy about the loans given by Finance Sudan.

loans.use: to buy clothing and other items for her store.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 42-year-old Palestinian woman.  She is married to Nahed and is a mother to one son.

For the past three years, Manal's husband has had a bookstore.  It has been profitable and the only source of income to the family, but also it needs more support to cover the costs.  And because of the start of the new school year, Manal wants to help her husband in paying the cost of purchasing printer ink that schools and associations request and purchase.  Manal is requesting a USD loan from Faten for this purpose.

What distinguishes this project is that it is located next to many schools in the area where they live. Taking this loan will increase sales and improve the family's income, which will enable them to live in better conditions.

Manal and her husband are looking to expand the bookstore in the future and have a special space for selling printer ink.

loans.use: to purchase printer ink for sale.

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate is 28 years old. She is a lady from Kisumu, and she is married to Jacob. Together, they have a four-month-old baby.

She operates a printing, photocopying and typesetting business. She has been doing this business for the last three years, and she makes a monthly income of KES. 15,000. 


She is now taking her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use this loan to buy printing papers and repair printing machines. Immaculate intends to use the profits to buy another printing machine. Her dream is to open another business outlet.

loans.use: To buy printing papers and repair printing machines.

loans.name: Janerose

texts.en:
Janerose  is a 43-year-old married woman. She has six children, with ages ranging from 5 years to 25 years. She describes herself to be hard-working.

She operates a retail store where she sells cereals such as maize, beans, etc.  She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located at an ideal business location, and her primary customers are local residents.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be high transportation costs.   This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more cereals for selling.  Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be the best selling businesswoman of cereals in her home area.

loans.use: to buy more cereals for selling.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a Palestinian single young man. For the past three years, Mohammad has had a mobile phone store, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for him, but also it needs more support to cover the cost.

Mohammad is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a new collection of mobile phones accessories and upgrading the decor of the store: painting and installing new shelves and lights.

Taking this loan will create a new image for the store and attract more customers, especially since Mohammad has a good reputation among his customers and his store is located in a good commercial area in the market, which will lead to increasing Mohammad's income and ensure him a bright future and better living conditions.
