Mohammad is photographed in his store.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phones accessories and upgrade the decor of the store

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is married with seven children. All of her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members.  

Juliet has a pub. She has been in the local gin business for 10 years. She sells all categories of people except for children. She works - both retail and wholesale - seven days a week from her home. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. Juliet has applied for a loan of 800000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more jerrycans of local Gin. 

She aspires to sell wholesale only and to buy a plot of land to build her own house. She resides in a rented house with access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local Gin

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 28 years old, a lady from Kisumu County, and is married to Maurice. They have two children aged six and three years.

Rose operates a tailoring business, a business she has been doing for the last two years, and makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is now taking her second loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy more stock of textile materials for dressmaking and other tailoring work. She plans to use the expected profits to expand her stock  of materials. 

Her dream is to be the biggest supplier of textile materials and also educate her children well.

loans.use: To buy textile materials.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 17 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past year, Sarah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells general household items like rice and sugar. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more soap, sugar and other general goods, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and help her expand her business and cover expenses. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to have more profits. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar and other general goods

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 35-year-old man from Kisumu City and is married to Millicent. They have two children, aged 12 and 8 years.

Francis sells secondhand shoes. He has been operating this business for the last 18 years, and makes a monthly income of KES. 20,000. He is now taking his fourth loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy a stock of secondhand shoes for sale. 

He plans to save the expected profits in a bank account and also cater for other household expenses.

His dream is to open another stall.

loans.use: to buy a stock of secondhand shoes for sale.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is 48 years old, married to Monica and blessed with four children, ages 23, 20, 18 and 14 years, respectively. 

Justus runs a spare parts shop where he sells motor vehicle and motorcycle spares. He started this business 8 years ago and earns a monthly income of 100,000 KES. He has requested a second loan of 60,000 KES to purchase motor vehicle and motorcycle spare parts for sale. 

Profits made will help him expand this business to a wholesale shop. Justus dreams of a bright future.

loans.use: To purchase motor vehicle and motorcycle spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 28-year-old lady from Kisumu and is married to Daniel. They have two children, ages 9 and 7 years.

Mary operates a secondhand clothing business, a business she has been doing for the last 5 years. She makes a monthly income of 7,000 KES. 

She is now taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy a stock of used clothing for sale. Mary plans to use her profits to educate her children. Her dream is to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy a stock of used clothing for sale.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 25-year-old lady from the Corner Legio area of Kisumu City. She is married to Harry. They have three children who are three, seven and nine.

Caroline operates a beauty salon, which also sells beauty products. She has been conducting this business for the last four years, and she makes a monthly income of KES.10,000. 

She is now taking her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use it to buy more cosmetics. She plans to use the expected profits to add more stocks of beauty products and to save for future use. Her dream is to open another salon branch elsewhere to maximize her income.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 28 years old, a lady from Nyalenda, Kisumu, and is married to William. They have three children aged 10, seven and four years.

Agnes operates a tailoring business, a business she has been doing for the last four years, and makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. Agnes is on her second loan with KADET LTD, a loan she is taking out to buy fabrics. She plans to to use the expected profits to increase her stock of materials.

Her dream is to open a big stall to operate her business from.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for dressmaking.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a 26-year-old single woman. She describes herself as a focused woman. She operates a retail stall where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. Caroline describes her biggest business challenge to be the high rate of tax charges on the business. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase clothes to sell. Her business goal is to run a boutique within 5 years. Caroline hopes that in the future, she will have a happy family where she will cater to their financial needs. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 30 years old, married to Jane and blessed with a one-year-old daughter. He sells motor vehicle and bicycle spare parts, a business he started five years ago and earns him approximately 27,000 KES in a month. 

He has requested a second loan of 60,000 KES to purchase motor vehicles spare parts. The profit Moses makes will aid him in expanding this business to other towns. He dreams of being successful in life and bringing up a neat and happy family.

loans.use: To purchase motor vehicle spare parts for sale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 41 years old and married, the mother of six children, four of whom are in school. 

For the past six years, she has been operating a meat-goat business; before that, she sold used clothes. Esther sells her goats mostly to butcher operators. 

She is requesting this loan to buy more goats. This way, she will continue to earn income to help cover the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy more goats.

loans.name: Al-Awfia Group

texts.en:
This group, called Al-Awfia, consists of four female members. They are from Sana`a, Yemen, and they know each other very well. All the group members are considered hard-working people who very much want to get ahead. This group took a loan of YER 220,000 from AMB. 

Rogia is a 37-year-old married woman who is happy to be a part of this group. She has been distributing ladies' clothes, perfumes, and incense. She started the business with a small amount to earn more profit. She loves her work and hopes to continue. 

Her portion of this group loan is YER 70,000, which she will use to continue buying fabrics, perfumes, and incense.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, perfumes, and incense for her business.

loans.name: Erinah

texts.en:
Erinah is a single mother of four children. All of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.

Erinah has a restaurant. She has been in this business for 8 years. She sells, on retail, to all categories of people. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more rice, beans, charcoal, beef, and bunches of bananas. Her major business challenges include seasonality and ever increasing prices of food stuffs in Uganda. She aspires to own a fully stocked restaurant and to buy a plot of land to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more rice, bunches of bananas, charcoal and beef

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is widowed with six children and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She resides in her own house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

Alice has a business of selling secondhand clothes and has been in this business for 10 years, selling to all categories of people, but on retail. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She works five days a week at the market. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. Alice is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to start importing used clothes.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a 37-year-old married woman, with four children. 

She owns a motorcycle taxi, and she employs a person to run it. She is a hard-working woman who needs to get ahead in life. 

Martha is requesting a loan to open a retail shop. She will use it to buy bales of flour, sugar, and other basic commodities. Her aim is to own a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy bales of flour, sugar, and other basic commodities.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa  lives together with her husband and four children at Asafora near Cape Coast.  She sells  cassava  and plantains.   Adjoa has been selling foodstuffs for 3 years now.  She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees.  Adjoa  will uses her loan to purchase cassava, plantains  and a variety of foodstuffs to sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cassava, plantains  and a variety of foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena lives together with her husband who is a farmer and two children at Abura.  Abena  produces charcoal  for sale at  Abura, which she has done for 5 years now.    She uses her income  to feed her family and pay her children’s school fees.  Abena  will use her loan to purchase firewood  to  produce charcoal  to  sell.  With the new profit from her expanded business,  Abena  will produce charcoal in large quantity.

loans.use: to purchase firewood  to  produce charcoal  to  sell

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa  produces charcoal  for sale  at  Abura, which she has done for 5 years now. Adjoa is  married with  three children  She uses her income to help her husband   to feed the family and pay her children’s school fees.  Adjoa  will use her loan to purchase firewood  to  produce charcoal  to  sell.  With the new profit from her expanded business,  Adjoa  will produce charcoal in large quantity.

loans.use: purchase firewood  to  produce charcoal  to  sell

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es: Cordiales Saludos. Les presento al grupo “Santa Rosa De Lima” conformado por 07 personas trabajadoras  que con esfuerzo han podido salir adelante con la finalidad de brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias. Este es el caso de    Jaqueline tesorera del grupo,  cargo que ha llevado con responsabilidad. Con mucho esfuerzo y  la ayuda de su esposo jaqueline pudo  cumplir una de sus metas, el de contar con negocio propio. La cual hace más de 04 años se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, siendo la gran mayoría de sus clientes vecinos de la zona. Gracias a este negocio ha logrado tener cierta estabilidad económica. Con este nuevo crédito seguirá invirtiendo en su negocio comprando golosinas, agua minera y gaseosas. Su mayor deseo es de ver a sus hijos profesionales. El grupo “Santa Rosa De Lima” están agradecidos y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Jaqueline tiene 39 años, casada con 02 hijos aún dependientes.   Ella es la tercera del lado izquierdo viste chompa color lila y pantalón marón.
texts.en: Greetings! Introducing “Santa Rosa de Lima”, a Communal Bank composed of 7 hardworking people who have succeeded in progressing in life thanks to their efforts, aiming at granting a better standard of living to their families. This is the case of Jaqueline, the treasurer of the group, a task she has responsibly carried out. Thanks to her great efforts and to her husband’s help, Jaqueline has succeeded in making one of her dreams come true: to have a shop of her own. She has been running a general store for more than 4 years, selling basic necessities to neighbors of her area, who constitute the majority of her customers. Thanks to this activity she has succeeded in granting herself a certain economic stability. She will use this new loan she is requesting to invest it in her activity by buying snacks, mineral water and fizzy drinks. What she wants the most is to see her children become professionals. The “Santa Rosa de Lima” Group are grateful and they commit to keeping on working well. Jaqueline is 39 years old, she is married and she has 2 children who still depend economically on her. She is the third form the left, wearing a lilac sweater and brown trousers.

loans.use: To buy snacks, mineral water and fizzy drinks.

loans.name: Mahugnon 15 Group

texts.fr: MAHUGNON 15 est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres résident dans la même maison. La représentante du groupe, Victoire (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 32 ans et est mariée à Pierre, un mécanicien. Le couple a trois enfants dont certains sont scolarisés. Victoire vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges. Il y a quinze années que Victoire mène comme activité la vente de produits vivriers (maïs, riz, haricot) et des assiettes à son domicile. Victoire s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Victoire mène cette activité afin de pouvoir aux besoins du ménage. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Victoire sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUGNON 15. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: Mahugnon 15 is a group of four women who all live in the same building.  The group representative, Victoire (with her hand raised in the photo) is 32 years old and married to Pierre, a mechanic.  The couple has three children, some of whom are in school.  Victoire lives with her children and husband, and the couple shares the various expenses.  For fifteen years, Victoire has been in the business of selling staple products (corn, rice, beans) and dishes from her home.  Victoire buys her products in a city in Benin.  She is in this business to meet her household's needs.  With the goal of satisfying her customers, Victoire is requesting her first credit along with the other members of the Mahugnon 15 group.  This loan will allow them to better meet their customers' needs and make a bigger profit.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn, rice, and beans.

loans.name: Omar De Jesus

texts.es:
Omar, necesita invertir más en sus actividades agropecuarias, es por eso que está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de dos terneros y lo necesario para poderles engordar (concentrado), esto le ayudara a mejorar la ganaderia y crear oportunidades futuras de obtener ganancias.

Con el crédito anterior manifiesta que le permitió tener los insumos necesarios para la agricultura y tener mejores ingresos gracias a ello ya que su cosecha estuvo bien, han cambiado las circunstancias familiares y han mejorado las condiciones económicas para la sostenibilidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Omar needs to invest more in his farming activities. For this reason he is seeking another loan in order to purchase two calves, and the necessary feed to fatten them. This will help him to expand his livestock and create future profit earning opportunities.

With the previous loan, he was able to gather the necessary agricultural supplies and therefore bring in a good harvest. He has been able to change his circumstances and to improve the economic conditions and sustainability of his family.

loans.use: to purchase two calves.

loans.name: Tujikaze Baco Group

texts.en:
“Tujikaze BaCo” is a group of 7 owners of small businesses that is chaired by Kazadi. The members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva, which they use to grow their businesses.

Kazadi sells soybeans and cassava flour in retail. She is 53 years old, married and the mother of eight children aged between 14 and 31 years old. Two of them go to school. She has been a micro-entrepreneur since 1981. She is a hard working woman who has demonstrated abilities in business such as organization and good management. Kazadi is a loyal client of the MFI HOPE RDC. She has already received eight different loans and has repaid them correctly. With the next loan, she plans to increase the stock of her goods by buying some sacks of soybeans in order to meet the high demand of her customers in her community. She is confident with her business. She knows how to attract her customers by offering them what they need and like. She is also diplomatic when she talks with her clients. Her business generates the profit of US$60 per week. She wants to be the main provider of soybeans in her community.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for resale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena  produces 'kenkey' (fermented maize dough) in large quantity and distributes the balls of 'kenkey' for sale at Abura. In the picture Abena  is removing the cooked kenkey from the pot.   Abena  has done this for three  years. She is married with seven children.  She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their accommodation bills.  Abena will use her loan to purchase bags of  maize and banana leaves as wrapping for her 'kenkey' production.  With the new profit,   Abena  plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of  maize and banana leaves for her 'kenkey' production.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba is married, and her husband is a fireman.

For the past four years Araba has sold secondhand ladies’ and children’ dresses. She uses her income to help pay the couple’s utility bills and rent.

Araba is applying for a 530 GHS loan from CRAN to buy extra secondhand dresses to sell. Her ambition is to keep her business growing.

loans.use: to buy extra secondhand dresses to sell.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa    sells charcoal   at  Abura, which she has done for three  years now.  Adjoa  is married  and has four  children  She uses her income  to help her husband to  feed the family and pay their children’s school fees.  Adjoa  will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal  to  sell.  With the new profit from her expanded business,   Adjoa  will produce the charcoal she sells herself.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal  to  sell

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa  lives together with her husband who is a farmer and three children at Abura.  Adjoa sells charcoal which she has done for six years.  She uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their home. Adjoa will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal to sell. With new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua   sells charcoal   at  Abura, which she has done for three  years now.  Efua  is married  and has two  children  She uses her income  to help her husband to  feed the family and pay their children’s school fees.   Efua   will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal  to  sell.  With the new profit from her expanded business,   Efua  will produce the charcoal she sells herself.

loans.use: purchase bags of charcoal  to  sell.

loans.name: Yuliya

texts.ru:
Юлия живет и работает в Мелитополе. Она торгует на местном рынке разного рода ритуальными товарами: продает венки, корзинки, гирлянды для похорон. У нее свое торговое место.  
Юлия работает в этой сфере торговли уже 16 лет. В этот раз она обратилась в КИВА за кредитом для того, чтобы закупить дополнительную партию товара под реализацию.
texts.en: Yulia lives and works in Melitopol. She sells various accessories for funerals (wreaths, baskets with plastic flowers and plastic flower garlands) at the local market. She has her own retail space. Yuliya has been working in retail for 16 years. She has applied for this Kiva loan in order to purchase additional items for sale in her market space.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for resale

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajando Juntas Group

texts.es:
El comité "Mujeres Trabajando Juntas" tiene mas de 5 años de formación y trabajo con la Fundación, todas las miembros gracias al trabajo en conjunto se están ayudando y de esa forma salen adelante.
La Sra. Marta es una de las integrantes de éste comité, se unió al comité por la necesidad que tenia, y pues quería poder ayudar a sus familiares. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y de verduras de todo tipo, con lo que está teniendo los medios para poder ayudar a los suyos, y nos comenta que anhela un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerza todos los días para darles la oportunidad de estudiar y lograr un futuro mejor.
Marta solicita el crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas y de verduras para poder seguir trabajando y dando variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee "Women Working Together" has been together for more than five years and works with the Foundation.  Thanks to the work of the group, all of the members are helping and in this way they get ahead.

Marta is one of the members of this committee.  She joined because of the need that she had, and because she wanted to help her family.  She works in the sale of fruits and vegetables of all types.  In this way she has the means to help her family, and she tells us that she hopes for a better future for her children and that this is why she works every day to give them the opportunity to study and to achieve a better future.  

Marta is requesting the loan to be able to invest in the purchase of fruits and vegetables to continue working and giving variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en: Kofi is married. He has received schooling through form 4. Kofi sells charcoal at Abur, which he has done for some time now. His wife is a trader. Kofi  uses his income to pay for his childre’s school fees. Kofi will use the loan to purchase an acacia plantation for charcoal. With the new profits, Kofi  hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase an acacia plantation for charcoal.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa   produces charcoal  for sale  at  Abura, which she has done for 5 years now. Adjoa is married with  three children.  She uses her income to help her husband   to feed the family and pay her children’s school fees.  Adjoa  will use her loan to purchase firewood  to  produce charcoal  to  sell.  With the new profit from her expanded business,  Adjoa  will produce charcoal in large quantity.

loans.use: to purchase firewood  to  produce charcoal  to  sell.

loans.name: Kwesi

texts.en: Kwesi  is married.  He has received schooling through form 4.  Kwesi  produces  charcoal  at  Abura,  which he has done  for some time now. His wife is a petty trader.  Kwesi  uses his income to pay for his children’s school fees.  Kwesi will use the loan to purchase an acacia plantation for charcoal. With the new profits,  Kwesi  hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase an acacia plantation for charcoal production

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua sells charcoal at Abura, which she has done for six years now.  Efua is married and has five children.  She uses her income to support her husband to feed and pay their children’s school fees.  

Efua will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal to sell.  With the new profit from her expanded business, Efua will be able to produce the charcoal she sells herself.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Natasha

texts.ru: Наталия уже использовала средства, полученные от КИВА ранее. Она смогла расширить свой товарный ассортимент и увеличить свою клиентуру. Тем не менее, она не хочет останавливаться на достигнутом и стремится идти дальше, поднимая свой бизнес на новый уровень. Наталии понадобилась сумма в размере 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить сумки и ремни тем самым разнообразить ассортимент товара у себя на точке.
texts.en: Natasha has already used up a previous loan from Kiva. The loan helped her to expand her inventory and gain more clients. Despite these accomplishments Natasha does not want to stop and is dedicated to taking her business to a new level. She would like to take out a loan of 5000 griven to purchase more bags and belts and so expand the variety of items she is offering at her market space.

loans.use: to purchase bags and belts

loans.name: Eterei

texts.en:
Eterei  is 38 years old and married, with seven children. 

She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as soft drinks, bags of flour, sacks of rice, cigarettes, and bags of sugar. She has been doing this for five years. 

Eterei needs a loan to re-stock some items in her shop. She hopes to use her profits to help with her famiy's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2008 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, bags of flour, rice, cigarettes, and sugar.

loans.name: Nina

texts.ru:
Нина уже один раз пользовалась кредитом КИВА. Она использовала полученные тогда средства для того, чтобы увеличить свой валовой доход и, соответственно, прибыль. 
В этот раз Нине необходима сумма в размере 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести еще одну торговую точку напротив уже имеющейся. Это – железный контейнер, с которого Нина будет торговать вдобавок к уже раскрученной торговой точке. Нина надеется, что полученные дополнительные средства дадут ей дополнительные возможности для развития бизнеса в будущем.
texts.en:
Nina has already used one loan form KIVA. She invested the profits from the loan into expanding her store's gross revenue and consequentially her store's profits. 

This time Nina would like to take out a loan of 15,000 griven to purchase a second sale space right across from her main store. It's a metal trailer where Nina will be selling additional items while taking advantage of her client base who come to her current sale space. Nina hopes that the profits from the expansion will substantially increase her profits and provide her with more opportunities to develop her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase another sale space

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.ru: Икром   1989 года рождения.    Женат и имеет одного сына.    Супруга Икрома домохозяйка и занимается воспитанием сына.    С 2009 года Икром занимается ремонтом всех марок легковых автомобилей и это его основной доход.    Икром хочет получить  кредит   в сумме 7000 тысяч сомони на 18 месяцев.    Он давно мечтал купить себе собственный автомобиль но не как не может накопить денег поэтому решил обратится в Арванд.    Этот кредит он взял для приобретения собственного автомобиля.   Икром очень благодарен организации и планирует на дальнейшее сотрудничество.
texts.en: Ikrom was born in 1989. he is married and has one son. Ikrom's wife is a homemaker and is raising their son. Since 2009 Ikrom has been working as a car mechanic and is able to fix all makes and models of cars. This is the main source of income for the family. Ikrom needs to take out a loan of 7000 somoni for the duration of 18 months. He has always dreamed of owning a car but has had trouble saving the money for a vehicle, so he decided to turn to Arvand for a loan. Ikrom is very grateful to the organization and is hoping to be able to work with Kiva in the future.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Hokima

texts.ru: Хокима жительница района Файзабад. Ей 52 года. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Хокима живет с мужем. Ее дети более десяти лет занимается торговлей. У нее имеется собственный продуктовый магазин. Хокима просит кредит для покупки продуктов и хозяйственных товаров.
texts.en: Hokima lives in Fayzabad. She is 52 years old, married and has four children. Hokima lives with her husband. Her children have been working in retail for more then ten years. Hokima herself has a grocery store and she is requesting this loan to purchase groceries and household goods for resale in the store.

loans.use: to purchase sausages, sweets and household goods for resale

loans.name: Wangninan 21 Group

texts.fr: WANGNINAN 21 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, Mélanie dont la main est levée sur la photo, est âgée de 22 ans. Mélanie est mariée à un certain Clément. Le couple a deux enfants dont un est scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble, les différents besoins du ménage. Mélanie n’a pas fréquenté. Il y a près de dix ans que Mélanie mène comme activité la vente de riz, pâtes alimentaires, haricot à son domicile et aussi par le système de distribution. Mélanie exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Mélanie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Mélanie sollicite un crédit avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNINAN 21. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
WANGNINAN 21 is a group of three friends who belong to the same savings group. The group’s representative is Mélanie, raising her hand in the photo. Mélanie is 22 years old and she is married to a man named Clément. They have two dependent children, one of whom goes to school. The couple live with their children, and they handle the various household responsibilities together. 

Mélanie never went to school. She started to sell rice, pasta and beans 10 years ago, conducting her business from her home and through the distribution system. She buys her merchandise at a market in Benin. She has a passion for her work, which helps her to support herself and her children. 

To achieve customer satisfaction, Mélanie is seeking a loan together with the other members of WANGNINAN 21. This credit will allow them to better meet customer demand and to bolster their profits.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and beans.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en: Kevin, 21 years old, is a single man. He has no children yet. He describes himself to be focused man. He provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located at a rural area  and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of fuel used for the motorcycle. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. His business goal is to buy a tuk tuk ( taxi) to increase the transportation services  within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy spare motorcycle parts.

loans.name: Venera

texts.en:
Venera, 52, lives with her husband and twenty-year-old son, a student, in a small village in the Khoni district. She is a hardworking person with a great deal of farming experience.

Venera and her family earn their living through farming. Within their greenhouses they grow different kinds of greens, tomatoes and cucumbers. They grow maize and nut trees on their land. Venera also has four calves and four milk cows whose milk is used for cheese production. She sells her produce, cheese, nuts and maize at the local open market.

Venera is applying for a 1600 GEL loan through LLC to repair their greenhouse. She must buy polyethylene sheeting to cover it as well as fix the wooden framework. When the greenhouse is repaired, it will retain the warmth needed, and the family will harvest more produce. Their income will increase.

Venera plans to use the increased profits to expand their farm and improve the family’s living conditions. She will finance her son’s education to ensure him a better future. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to repair the family's greenhouse.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
Doña teresa (a la mitad de la fotografía) una mujer de 57 años de edad ella esta en unión simple con su esposo y vive en Sololá.  Junto a su esposo y sus 7 hijos de los cuales 1 esta estudiando en la escuela se apoyan para contribuir a la economía de la familia.
Ella se dedica a la fabricación de figuras de diferentes clases en hilos que se utilizan en los trajes típicos femeninos que  usan en su comunidad la cual se le llama (jaspeado). Ella aprendió hace unos años a realizar este trabajo con algunas personas donde trabajo un tiempo.
Ella es independiente trabajando con su propio capital desde hace 2 años viendo ella que su ganancia es buena y quiere seguir invirtiendo capital para seguir fabricando este tipo de producto.
Ella es la  representante de este grupo solicitando un préstamo para ampliar su negocio. Comprando hilos y tintes que utilizara, las demás integrantes (las dos de cada lado de la fotografía) son socias y se dedica a la c/v de ropa casual utilizando también una parte de este crédito comprando más ropa variada  y ampliar esta venta.
Las tres señoras tienen una meta de seguir invirtiendo y tener un negocio más grande en un futuro teniendo mejores ingresos para sus familias.
texts.en:
Teresa (the one in the center of the picture) is 57 years old, and she lives in Sololà together with her husband and their 7 children, 1 of whom is going to school. They support each other to contribute to the family’s economy.
She engages in creating different kinds of decorative motifs using the same thread generally employed to weave “jaspeado”, a typical female dress worn in her community. A few years ago she was working for some time for people who knew how to do this job and that is how she learned it.
She is economically independent, as she has been working investing her own capital for 2 years. Seeing that she earns good money, she wants to keep on investing working capital in her activity to keep on creating this type of product.
She represents this group and she is requesting a loan to expand her activity by buying thread and dyes she will use for her products. The other members (the other two women at each side of the picture) engage in selling casual clothes, and they will use a part of this loan to buy more kinds of clothes to expand their retailing activities.
These three ladies have a goal: to keep on investing and to run a bigger activity in the future, in order to earn more money for their families.

loans.use: To buy thread and dyes in different colors.

loans.name: Hikmatulo

texts.ru:
Хикматуло родился в 1969 году. Он проживает в городе Вахдат. Хикматуло женат. Он является отцом двоих детей. Образование у него среднее. Хикматуло хочет начать работать таксистом. Он намерен предоставлять услугу по маршруту Душанбе-Вахдат. 
Хикматуло просит кредит для приобретения автомобиля, чтобы начать свою деятельность.
texts.en: Hikmatulo was born in 1969. He lives in Vahdat. Hikmatulo is married and has two children. He has a high school degree and wants to start working as a taxi driver. He is planning to drive the Dushanbe-Vahdat route. Hikmatulo wants to take out a loan to purchase a care so that he can start his business.

loans.use: to purchase a car

loans.name: Mahmadali

texts.ru:
Махмадали проживает в городе Дангара. Ему 35 лет. Он женат. У него двое маленьких детей. Махмадали имеет средне - специальное образование, он шафер. По специальности Махмадали не работает. Вот уже четыре года как он занимается скотоводством. Махмадали разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Он разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. 
Махмадали берет кредит для закупа бычков с целью увеличения поголовья крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Mahmadali lives in Dangara. He is 35 years old, married and has two small children. Mahmadali has a professional degree as a driver but doesn't work in his profession. Instead, for the last four years Mahmadali has been raising cattle for subsequent resale at the market. He raises the animal on his home plot. Mahmadali would like to take out a loan to purchase a few calves so that he can expand his herd.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Шарофат женщина в возрасте 44 лет.   Она  разведена и не имеет детей. У нее  нет  никакой поддержки от родных, поэтому  она начала заниматься мелким бизнесом.   Свой бизнес Шарофат  начинала с  семечек и с каждым годом увеличивала ассортимент товара.  Сейчас она  уже начала продавать жвачки, мелкие детские игрушки и т.д. Шарофат  на полученный  кредит  хочет расширить свой бизнес и улучшить место продажи.  Она благодарна МДО "Арванд" за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Sharofat is 44 years old, divorced, and has no children. She does not receive any support from family, which is why she started a small business. Sharofat began selling seeds and, with each year, she has increased the range of goods she sells. Now she has begun to sell chewing gum, small children's toys, and so on. Sharofat is seeking a loan to expand her business and improve her sales outlet. She is grateful to MDO Arvand for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and toys

loans.name: Mirdas

texts.en:
Mirdas, 36, is married and lives with his family in the village of Zanati . He has two children aged fifteen and sixteen years who attend school; their grandmother lives with them as well. Mirdas is a hardworking person with rich experience in his work.

The family earns their living through farming. Mirdas grows maize on the family’s land and sells on average 1,500 kg. of maize a year. They also have three pigs plus five cows whose milk is used to make cheese which they sell locally.

Mirdas is applying for a 1000 GEL loan through LLC to buy another milk cow. He wants to produce and sell more cheese so as to earn more in profits. He plans to use his profits to reinvest in his farm as well as spend more on the family’s daily needs. Overall, the family’s living conditions will be improved.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.ru: Нуриддин получает кредит для того чтобы оплатить за обучение в университете.   Он еще не женат, но живет с родителями.    Нуриддин учится в Университете , что бы получить высшее образование и стать финансистом.   В свободное время водит такси по городу.   Кроме этого, в сезонное время, он продает арбузы и дыни.    Его отец также работает, он обменивает иностранные и национальные валюты,  мать домохозяйка.   Но Нуриддин не надеется на своих родителей, он считает что он уже достаточно самостоятельный чтобы обеспечить себя сам.    В этом году он поступил в Университет, и посоветовавшись с своими родителями обратился в  "Арванд".    Его родители согласны на получение кредита, потому что у них нет достаточной суммы  чтобы оплатить за обучение сына в университете.
texts.en: Nuriddin needs to take out a loan to that he can pay for his university education. He is not married and lives with his parents. Nuriddin is attending the university so that he can receive a bachelor's degree in finance. In his spare time he drives a taxi and also sells watermelons and cantaloupes when they are in season. Nuriddin's father works at a currency exchange shop and his mother is a home maker. Nuriddin does not want to rely on his parent's savings to provide for his education but feels that it is his responsibility to finance his education independently. This year Nuriddin was admitted to the university and, after consulting with his parents, deiced to turn to Arvand for a loan. His parents have agreed to the loan because they do not have enough savings to pay for the education of their son.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Toirjon

texts.ru: Тоирчон, родился в 1992 году.  Он живёт вместе с матерью и сестрой. Занимается купля-продажей сухофруктов. Этим он занимается в течении 2-х лет вместе с матерью.  За счет этой деятельности он получает  хорошую прибыль  каждый месяц. Тоирчон  также занимается ремонтом жилищных помещений, но хороший доход у него от сухофруктов.  На полученный кредит он планирует закупить сухофруктов с города и продавать на местном рынке. Таким образом Тоирчон хочет расширить свою деятельность. Заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Toirjon was born in 1992. He lives together with his mother and sister. For the last two years Toirjon has been selling dried fruits together with his mother. This business yields a good monthly profit but Toirjon also works as a home repair man to supplement the family's income. He is taking out this loan to purchase a big batch of dried fruits in the city and sell them at the local markets. Toirjon is planing to use this as a way to expand the family business and he is grateful in advance for the financial assistance from Arvand.

loans.use: to buy dried fruit

loans.name: Victoire Group

texts.fr: La cliente Faida est présidente du collectif d’affaire dénommé « Victoire », âgée de 48 ans, mariée, mère de 8 enfants, son mari est un chômeur mais il réalise des petites commissions sur les transactions de vente de parcelle. Son fils ainé a 26 ans et le cadet a 8 ans et tous étudient. la cliente est vendeuse de boissons. Il y a plus 26 ans, elle exerce ce petit commerce. Elle commença avec ses fonds propre reçu de son père. Elle vient de réaliser 18 cycles dans le programme de microcrédit de Hekima. Elle expose ses marchandises à son domicile et parfois sur le long de la route. Le grand obstacle est qu’elle vend en monnaie nationale (franc congolais), qui connait parfois de perte de change avec la devise (dollars).  Ce nouveau crédit  lui servira  de s’approvisionner avec 50 casiers de Primus et 30 Fanta et le reste d’argent sera affecté dans l’investissement. Elle souhaite voir ses enfants finir les études universitaires et agrandir son activité. La cliente salut courageusement l’initiative de  l’IMF Hekima pour ses actions dédiées à l’autonomisation des femmes exclues de système bancaire classique.
texts.en: The client Faida is president of the business collective named "Victory".  She is 48 years old and married with eight children.  Her husband is unemployed, but he earns small commissions on land sales transactions.  Her oldest son is 26 and the youngest is 8; all of them study.  Faida has been selling drinks for more than 26 years, beginning with money she received from her father.  She has just completed 18 cycles in the Hekima microcredit program.  She sells her products from home and sometimes along the roadside.  Faida's biggest obstacle is that she sells in the national currency (Congolese franc), which sometimes suffers from exchange losses against the dollar.  This new loan will allow her buy 50 cases of Primus and 30 of Fanta, and the rest of the money will be invested.  She wants to see her children complete university studies and to enlarge her business.  Faida praises the initiative of IMF Hekima for its actions dedicated to increasing the independence of women excluded from the conventional banking system.

loans.use: to buy 50 cases of Primus and 30 of Fanta, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: San Buenaventura Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Buenaventura tiene 13 integrantes muy trabajadoras, ellas activan siempre con emprendedurismo y respeto, la Sra. Lourdes quien es la como coordinadora de finanzas del grupo tiene el objetivo de guiarlas siempre para mantener la unidad del grupo. Actualmente se encuentran en 11º ciclo.
Lourdes se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo y cuenta que ya tiene muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella sus alimentos, y es por ello que solicita esta ayuda, ya que quiere comprar carne, verduras, condimentos, harina, huevos y demás, para poder seguir haciendo los deliciosos platillos que hace.
texts.en:
The San Buenaventura group has 13 very hardworking members, always working with entrepreneurialism and respect. Lourdes who is the financial coordinator of the group has the aims to guide them and always maintain the unity of the group. They are currently in the 11th cycle. 

Lourdes sells all types of groceries and already has a very good clientele that always buy their food from her. Therefore, she is requesting this loan as she wants to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, flour, eggs and more in order to keep making the delicious dishes that she makes.

loans.use: buy meat, vegetables, condiments, flour, eggs and more.

loans.name: Iskhok

texts.ru: Исхок с 2009 года является нашим постоянным активным клиентом.   Он женат и имеет шестерых детей.   Жена домохозяйка и занимается домом и воспитанием детей.   Когда Исхок взял первый кредит для животноводство у него было 20-голов скота.    Он расширил свой бизнес и теперь у него 38-голов скота.    Он всю свою жизнь занимается этим видом деятельности так как не имеет образования и это единственный доход в его семье .    Его сыновья ему помогают.   Исхок уже знает все преимущество в этом деле и не нарушает политику кредитования.   На полученный кредит хочет купить еще несколько голов скота.    Заранее благодарит
texts.en: Iskhok has been an active client since 2009. He is married and has six children. His wife is raising the kids and taking care of the household. When Iskhok took out his first KIVA loan his herd contained 20 cows. He expanded his business and now his herd has 38 cows. Iskhok has been raising animals all his life, since he has no education and this is the sole source of income for his family. His sons help their father take care of the animals. Iskhok knows all the tricks of the trade and has never broken a loan agreements. He would like to use the current loan to purchase a few more animals for his herd. Iskhok is grateful in advance to all the lenders!

loans.use: to purchase of livestock

loans.name: Qambaroi

texts.ru: Камбарой- женщина средних лет по профессии преподаватель английского языка  работает в районной школе.Имеет большой стаж работы.Муж тоже  дипломированный врач и ведет свою деятельность в районной больнице.Так как  размер государственной зарплаты очень маленький и еле хватает на проживание, сельский народ занимается животноводством.Камбарой с мужем дома держат скот более 20ти лет и это очень своевременное занятие в семье.Её сын и невестка находятся в России на заработках, как многие односельчане и помогают родителям.Но Камбарой старается не использовать  деньги сына и накопить их  для постройки дома.Сейчас она узнала о нашей организации и обратилась  к нам за финансовой помощью, чтобы купить себе еще несколько голов скота и увеличить поголовье.Она надеется получить хорошую прибыль и таким образом сотрудничать с нами долго.
texts.en: Qambaroi is a middle-aged woman who is an English teacher by profession. She works in a local school and has many years of experience. Her husband is a licensed doctor who practices in a local hospital. Because workers who are paid from the public purse receive small salaries that barely cover living expenses, those residents living in rural areas also raise cattle. Qambaroi and her husband have kept cattle at home for more than 20 years. This is a very opportune situation for the family at this time, since Qambaroi's son and daughter-in-law have gone to Russia to earn money to help their parents, just as many of their peers do. However, Qambaroi tries not to use their money, saving it to build a house instead. Now she has found out about MDO Arvand and has come for financial assistance to buy several more head of cattle to increase her herd. Qambaroi is hoping to earn a good income and to co-operate with us for a long time.

loans.use: to buy  cattle

loans.name: Irada

texts.en:
Irada lives with her husband and family in a village in the Gardabani district. She has two children six and eight years old, and her parents-in-law live with the family as well. The children go to the local school and her parents-in-law are pensioners.

The family works on its farm. Irada is raising six calves, while her husband cuts down trees in the forest and sells the wood in the village.

With a 1600 GEL loan from LLC, the family plans to buy five calves, raise them and sell them next spring when they will fetch a higher price. This will increase the family’s income, and Irada will be able to reinvest the profits in the farm. She will buy a cow and use its milk to produce dairy products, so increasing the farm’s output.

Irada will work hard to do her best for the family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy five calves.

loans.name: Martha Kathiuska

texts.es: Martha se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, escogió esta actividad porque quería ayudar a sus hijos ya que  tiene 2 niños pequeños a quienes cuida por eso  no puede trabajar en una empresa. El trabajo es independiente y en la investigación que realizo le pareció rentable, empezó vendiendo bajo el código de otra persona pero esto no le ayudaba ya que quien ganaba las promociones por volúmenes de venta era su amiga. Cuando pudo reunir dinero para capitalizarse se acerco a la empresa y se registro con su propio código. El  trabajo  lo realiza sola haciendo recorridos y visitando a sus clientes ya sea para cobrar o entregar y recoger pedidos. Su horario normalmente es desde las 9:00 de la mañana hasta las 11:00 y luego sale a las 15:00 hasta las 17:00 realiza este intervalo porque regresa a casa para atender a sus hijos. Martha vende productos como perfumes, maquillaje, lápices labiales etc., los cuales compra teniendo un margen del 30% en sus ventas. Vive en Duran y es divorciada. Con el préstamo va a comprar productos como perfumes, maquillaje, ropa y calzado para la venta esperada obtener mejores resultados. A futuro espera poder ponerse un negocio mejor establecido y así ayudar más en los ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
Martha works selling beauty products via catalogue.  She chose this activity because she wanted to help her children since she has two little ones she cares for and which is why she is unable to work in a firm.  The work’s independent and the research she did made her feel it was profitable so she started selling under another person’s code but this wasn’t very helpful for her because the person who won the rewards for volume sales was her girlfriend.  When she was able to gather together money to capitalize herself she approached the firm and registered with her own code number.

She works alone on her routes visiting customers either to collect payment or to take orders.  Her normal schedule is 9 to 11 in the morning and then again from 3pm-5pm.  She takes this break in order to be return home to care for her children.  Martha sells such things as perfume, make-up, lipstick, etc. that she buys; her profit margin is 30%.  

She lives in Duran and is divorced.  She will use the loan to buy products like perfume, make-up, clothes and shoes to sell hoping to obtain better results.  In future she wants to open a better situated business to help more with household income.

loans.use: to buy perfume, make-up and clothes.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es:
Dionisio  vive en Puntarenas. Es una persona con experiencia en la agricultura y ama lo que hace.
El tiene su propia finca, y desea empezar a sembrar frijoles y maíz para la venta, aprovechando el clima y la demanda propia de época. Para eso el desea un préstamo de  ₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de abonos y Insecticidas, necesarios para la producción de estos granos.
El desea aumentar su producción y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Dionisio lives in Puntarenas.  He’s a person with experience in agriculture and he loves what he does.  He has his own farm and wants to start planting beans and corn to sell taking advantage of the weather and the usual seasonal demand.  He needs a ₡500,000 (five-hundred thousand Colones) loan to buy manure and insecticide needed for growing these grains.  He wants to increase production to help improve his family’s quality of life this way.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure and insecticide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure and insecticide.

loans.name: Camino Al Futuro Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CAMINO AL FUTURO”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es  el señor  Raúl, el socio es conviviente y tiene 41 años y tiene 2 hijos; él socio alterna sus actividades diarias brindando el servicio de taxi, el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 07:00am hasta las 07:00pm aproximadamente, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

EL socio solicita el crédito para el mantenimiento de su carro como en el cambio de aceite.

Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de cafetín, confección de mochilas, snack, laboratorio fotográfico, venta de helados, diseño y producción de videos, servicio urbano.

La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.

EL socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Introducing the members of "Camino al Futuro” (Way to the Future), a Communal Bank located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Raúl is one of the members of the group. He lives with his life partner, he is 41 years old and he has 2 children. He alternates his daily chores with his activity as a taxi driver. He has been engaged in this activity for many years and things are going well thanks to the determination he daily works with. He works Mondays to Fridays from 7 am to 7 pm approximately. Raúl is a responsible and persevering person, as though this activity she provides for her family.

He is requesting a loan to pay for maintenance works on his vehicle such as changing oil.

The other members of the group engage in running a small café, making backpacks, selling snacks, running a photo lab, selling ice-creams, designing and producing videos and working for city transportation services.

The person hidden behind the white dot is not a member of the Communal Bank.

He is grateful to those that will help him making his dream come true through this mean, and he commits to complying with the repayment of his dues according to schedule.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Mirna Guadalupe

texts.es:
Mirna, necesita fortalecer mas la venta de productos de primera necesidad, es por eso que solicita un crédito nuevamente para poder invertirlo en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, maíz y demás productos para su negocio, ya que esto le ayudara a seguir atendiendo a sus clientes.
Ella comenta que con el préstamo anterior invirtió en mas productos para surtir mas su tienda y esto le ayudo a generar más ganancias y crecer en clientes, actualmente goza de una mejor objetividad en cuento a su negocio y sus condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Mirna needs to increase her sales of basic staples. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, oil, corn, and other products for her business. This will help her to continue to serve her clients.
She comments that she invested her previous loan in more products to stock her store, and that this helped her to generate more earnings and increase her customer base. She now feels more objective about her business and her economic conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, corn.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario labora en una arrocera y es padre de tres hijos, todos son estudiantes, su salario es el único ingreso familiar, su hijo mayor ya ingresó a la Universidad, pero para continuar sus estudios superiores necesita matricular un nuevo bloque de estudios, por esta razón Mario su padre está solicitando un crédito por quinientos mil colones exactos (¢500.000) pagar la matrícula y comprar los materiales de estudio de este nuevo  período.
Don Mario y su hijo agradecen mucho la ayuda que este proyecto les brinda porque les facilita crédito accesible y rápido.
texts.en: Mario works at a rice processing plant and is the father of three children; all are students.  His salary is the family’s only income.  His oldest son is already attending the university but in order to continue with his higher education he needs to enroll in a new block of courses and this is why Mario, his father, is requesting this loan for exactly five-hundred thousand Colones to pay tuition and study materials for the new period.  Mario and his son are very grateful for the help this project provides because it makes credit available easily and quickly.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es: Marie tiene 50 años estado civil divorciada, no tiene hijos. Ella es nacida en la sierra de Ecuador pero casi toda su vida la ha pasado en Duran– Ecuador Cuando estaba casada ella y su ex esposo se pusieron un negocio de ventas de legumbres en un mercado de Duran. Ella actualmente trabaja sola de 6:00am hasta 17:00pm ese es la fuente de dinero. Su sueño es ser una comerciante mayorista ella quisiera exportar sus productos fuera del país .Con el préstamo ella quisiera comprar: mercadería, víveres en general , legumbres
texts.en: María, 50, is divorced and has no children.  She was born in the mountains in Ecuador but has spent most of her life in Duran, Ecuador.  When she was married she and her ex-husband opened a vegetable stand in the Duran market.  She currently works alone from 6am until 5pm and this is her source of money.  Her dream is to be a wholesale merchant and she’d like to export her products abroad.  She would like to use the loan to buy merchandise, foodstuffs in general and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, foodstuffs and vegetables.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita, habitante de la ciudad de Estelí, ama de casa, madre soltera, sus hijos están estudiando al igual que ella, está cursando el quinto año de  la carrera de Derecho. Su propósito  es darle lo mejor nivel de vida a sus y lograr tener una carrera profesional. Ella sobrevive por medio de la pulpería, negocio con el cual mantiene  a su familia y paga los gastos del hogar. Considera que en donde está ubicada es un lugar muy bueno pues no hay muchas pulperías alrededor. 
Requiere el financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, productos de limpieza, aceite. Cuadernos, lápices, libretas, borradores, cosméticos, salsas, enlatados etc. Pues esto la ayudara a surtir de más  productos, variar la mercadería y ofrecer diferentes productos que las demás pulperías no venden.
texts.en:
Margarita lives in the city of Estelí. She is a housewife and a single mother. Her children are studying, as is she; she is in her fifth year of a degree in law. Her goal is to provide her family with a better standard of living, and to achieve a professional career.  She gets by by means of her general store, a business through which she maintains her family and covers the household costs. She thinks that her location is very good because there are not many general stores in the area.
She needs a loan for the purchase of basic staples, cleaning products, oil, pencils, notebooks, erasers, cosmetics, sauces, canned goods, etc. This will help her to stock up on more products, to vary her merchandise, and to offer different products that the other general stores don't offer.

loans.use: to buy basic staples, cleaning products, oil, notebooks, pencils, erasers, cosmetics, sauces, and canned goods.

loans.name: Yendry

texts.es:
Yendry es una joven comerciante, ella compra mercadería como ropa, zapatos, cosméticos y otros artículos , luego los vende en su tienda a los vecinos de su localidad y de comunidades vecinas, con esta actividad lleva el sustento a su hogar y ahorra para estudiar, debido a que se acerca la época donde el comercio tiene gran actividad ella necesita prepararse con variedad y calidad de mercadería, por esta razón está solicitando un crédito de ochocientos mil colones exactos (¢800.000).
Manifiesta su satisfacción por poder contar con este apoyo financiero.
texts.en:
Yendry is a young merchant. She buys merchandise such as clothing, shoes, and cosmetics, which she later sells in her store to her neighbours and to residents of neighbouring areas. This is how she sustains her household and saves up for her studies. Because we are coming up on a busy season, she needs to get ready with a large variety and quality of merchandise. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of exactly eight hundred thousand colones (¢800.000).
She says that she is very happy to be able to count on this financial support.

loans.use: to buy clothing, cosmetics, and footwear.

loans.name: Dibby

texts.es: La Sra. Dibby tiene 23 años, tiene un hijo  de la edades de  1 año, ella se dedica al servicio de peinados y de manicurista y también maquillaje en su salón de belleza que se encuentra en la localidad de Paurito de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Dibby va a utilizar este préstamo  para la compra de productos de peluquería y belleza  y también para  algunos materiales que necesita y así de esta manera incrementar  su capital de trabajo,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que necesita ampliar su negocio, la Sra. Dibby enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tener mayor cobertura del mercado y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando materiales y mejorando su trabajo.
texts.en:
Dibby, 23, has a one-year-old son.  She does hair styling services, manicures and also make-up in her beauty salon located in the city of Santa Cruz’s Paurito section.  

This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Dibby will use it to buy some barber and beauty supplies as well as some materials she needs in order to increase her working capital.  The reason for requesting this loan is that she needs to expand her business.

The business challenge Dibby faces is to capture a wider market share and she will use profits to continue buying materials and improving her work.

loans.use: to buy barber and beauty supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy kitchen supplies.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María, necesita fortalecer mas su negocio es por eso que está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para la compra de Maíz, leña, quesillo, chicharrón, frijoles, todo tipo de condimentos, frutas para hacer los refrescos y demás cosas para su venta de pupusas y tortillas, con esta inversion podra brindarles una mejor atención a sus clientes.
Ella considera que con el crédito anterior pudo mejorar su negocio y con las ganancias a podido ayudar a su familia, por el momento se encuentra mejor que antes sus hijos seguirán estudiando y su negocio se ha mantenido.
texts.en:
Maria needs to strengthen her business and therefore is seeking a new loan to buy corn, wood, cheese, fried pork rinds, beans, all types of condiments, fruits to make refreshments and other things for the sale of pupusas and tortillas. With this loan she will be able to provide better service to her clients. 

She believes that with the previous loan she was able to improve her business and with the profits she has been able to help her family. At the moment, her kids are better than before and will continue to study and her business has maintained.

loans.use: buy corn, wood, cheese, fried pork rinds and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to sow corn and beans.

loans.name: Elena Siaki

texts.en: Elena  is 39 years old and married with 4 children. She runs a small business selling food and drinks in her canteen and has been doing this for 2 years. Elena has requested a loan to buy mutton flaps, rice, onions, curry, and soft drinks. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Elena will help pay for her children's education.

loans.use: mutton flaps, rice, onions, curry, and soft drinks

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is 58 years old and married. She is from La Ezperanza, Rizal. She manages her banana farm. This is where she get her income. She has been raising bananas for 6 years and earns 6,000 a month. In 2011, Evangeline joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 8,000 to purchase fertilizer, and for to pay for weeding costs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, and to pay for the cost of weeding

loans.name: Loreza

texts.en: Loreza is married with two children. She is 30 years old and resides in Dicoloc, Jimenez. She owns and operates a gardening business to earn a living, and she's been in this business for 8 years. Each month, she earns PHP 6,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase fertilizer. Loreza has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Loreza wants to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Novelita

texts.en: Novelita is from Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old and single. To make a living, she manages a business buying and selling fish. She has been in her business for 3 years and earns PHP 4,000 a month from these activities. In 2011, Novelita joined GDMPC. Novelita is requesting a loan of PHP 7,500 which will be used to buy additional fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en: Manuel is married with four children. He is 67 years old who lives in Sto. Niño, Tukuran. Manuel operates a service-based business providing transportation services to earn a living. He has been doing this for 17 years, and every month he earns 10,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase spare vehicle parts and accessories. Manuel been a member of GDMPC since 2009. In the future, Manuel hopes to finish the education of his children and to double the income from his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare vehicle parts and accessories

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is married with 3 children. He is 41 years old and resides at Tinotongan, Tukuran. Joel farms rice for a living, and has been in this business for 10 years. Each month, he earns 8,000 PHP. He has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2011, Joel joined GDMPC. In the future, he wants to establish some savings as a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase additional farmland.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion is 37 years old, married, and the mother of 1 child. She lives in Camanga, Tukuran, where she has earned a living for the last 3 years by selling used and home products. She makes PHP 9,000 a month and is applying for a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. Concepcion joined GDMPC recently as a way to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 31 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ligaya is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ligaya has been raising pigs for seven years and also earns additional income from an internet cafe.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina de 51 años, un mujer emprendedora madre de 3 hijos quienes con el apoyo de sus padres desempeñan estudios superiores motivo por el cual se encuentran fuera de la zona. Vive conjuntamente con Cayo  su esposo en una casa construida a base de madera. Se dedica a la producción de cacao en las parcelas que heredó de sus padres hace 30 años. Cayo quien siempre esta al tanto apoya en todo lo que sea necesario pues sabe que el trabajo en equipo será finalmente más beneficioso para los dos.
Finalizada la temporada de cosecha  necesita realizar un mantenimiento integral de sus parcelas debido a que hallo un mal denominado “Seca-Seca” el cual es muy devastador si no se llega a tomar las medidas del caso por tanto esta en la obligación de renovar algunas plantaciones de cacao en gran proporción, para ello tiene planeado contratar a jornaleros quienes laboran realizando dichas actividades así como el abono respectivo de los árboles de cacao optimizando la producción.
Al realizar su trabajo tiene siempre en mente a sus hijos a quienes brinda todo el apoyo económico necesario con tal de algún día  verlos culminar sus estudios profesionales y desempeñándose independientemente. Este es su tercer crédito con el cual agradece por la confianza brindada por MFP, en adelante se compromete a cumplir como siempre con sus cuotas ya que los créditos otorgados siempre le fueron muy beneficiosos. Comenta también que le agrada desempeñarse como socio en su banco comunal ya que en grupo se siente más confiada e informada al momento de ser beneficiada.
Con los 2,500 soles contratará jornaleros para la extracción de árboles infectados y la compra de almácigos  para el reemplazo de los mismos así como la compra de abonos orgánicos para una adecuada producción.
texts.en:
Dina is a 51-year-old resourceful woman and a mother of 3 children. Her children are not living in the area at the moment, as they are attending higher education courses thanks to the support provided by herself and her husband. Dina lives with Cayo, her husband, in a wooden house. She engages in growing cocoa in the plots of land she inherited form her parents 30 years ago. Cayo, who has the situation always under control, supports her with everything that is needed, as he knows that team works will repay them both better in the end.
Now that the harvest season is over, Dina needs to provide full maintenance to her plots of land to protect them form a disease called “Seca-Seca”, and it can be a very devastating blight if not sopped with the proper means. For this reason she sees herself obliged to substitute some cocoa plantations on a vast scale, and she plans on hiring daily laborers who will carry out this job as well as give the respective manure to the cocoa trees, thus optimizing the production.
While she works she always thinks about her children, to whom she offers all the economic support they need in hope to see them completing their professional studies and becoming economic independent in the future. This is her third loan with MFP, and she is grateful to the institution for trusting her. She commits to always complying with the repayment of her dues, as she has always greatly benefited from the other loans she has received. She also says that she likes being a member of her Communal Bank because she feels more confident and she gets more information on receiving benefits when staying in a group.
The 2,500 PER she is requesting will be used to hire daily laborer to extract the infected trees and to buy nursery trees to replace the infected one, as well as to buy manure to grant herself an adequate production.

loans.use: To buy nursery plants, manure and to pay for daily labors.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella is from Tabuan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 36 years old, married, and has 9 children. To make a living, Estrella owns & operates a retail store where she sells daily-use home products. She has been in business for 2 years, and earns 4,000 PHP a month. In 2011, Estrella joined GDMPC.  She is now requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Jicyl

texts.en: Jicyl's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She is 20 years old, married and has 1 child. She is from Camanga, Tukuran and been farming for 2 years, earning an income of 3,800 PHP a month. Recently, Jicyl joined GDMPC, and is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more recycled materials to resell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 65 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling recycled materials in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials to sell.

Victoria has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business buying and selling recycled materials for 38 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Victoria aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more recycled materials to resell

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine is a 27-year-old resident of Sto. Niño, Tukuran. Geraldine provides her two children's needs from the little amount of 10,000 PHP she has earned monthly from her own piggery business for 2 years, as an aid to the income earned by her husband. However,in 2007 she became a member of GDMPC, and she applied for a loan at GDMPC micro finance of 25,000 PHP to buy feeding supplies. Geraldine wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Vevincia

texts.en:
Vevincia is 46 years old and has five children. Vevincia is married and has one child who is in school. She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Vevincia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Vevincia has been raising pigs for 12 years now and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Vevincia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: As a married parent of nine children, Norma works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Norma is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella is married with 4 children. She is 58 years old, and lives in Camanga, Tukuran. She owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale to earn a living. Estrella has been in this business for 31 years, and she earns 25,000 PHP each month. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and pay for land plowing. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Estrella wants to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for land plowing

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 33 years old and married. She lives in San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, with her two children. 

Elsie owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 19,000 to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. 

Elsie been a member of GDMPC since 2011. Elsie wishes to gain more income and to expand her business, as well as to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee.

loans.name: Arriza

texts.en:
Arriza is 41 years old and married with seven children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Arriza has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Arriza aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a broom-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her broom-making business.

NWTF is presenting Alma's business for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for broom-making

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María, una joven de 27 años, originaria de Estelí , de oficio comerciante , madre de 3 hijos . Ella vende bisuterías y mercadería variada. Comenzó son solo un exhibidor de metal y poca  mercadería poco a poco ha ido creciendo su negocio. Ahora no solo vende bisutería también vende ropa interior, tiene bastante clientela, le gustaría tener una tienda en la parte central de la ciudad para captar más clientes. Ella requiere un financiamiento Kiva para comprar bisuterías y ropa interior. Ya que necesita mantener surtida su tienda de nuevos productos con variedad de estilos para que sea más atractivos para la clientela.
texts.en:
Maria, 27, is a native of Esteli.  She is a merchant, and she is also the mother of 3 children.  She sells accessories and other merchandise.  She started out with only 1 metal display stand and a small amount of merchandise, and then she gradually grew the business.  Now she sells not only accessories, but also underwear.
