She has a substantial customer base, and she would like to have a store in the center of the city so that she could attract more customers.  

Maria needs a Kiva loan to buy accessories and underwear, because she needs to keep her store well-stocked with new products in a variety of styles so that her business will be more attractive to her customers.

loans.use: to buy accessories and underwear

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en: Rufina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a candle making business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her candle making business. She has been in this business for eight years, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rufina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of her loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her candle-making business

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza is 44 years old and married with four children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in the business for 21 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF – and more recently, from Kiva – to sustain it. Analiza has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is married with five children. She is 33 years old and lives in San Carlos, Tukuran. For five years Lourdes has farmed rice. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for the next crop. Recently, Lourdes joined GDMPC. In the future, She wants to make improvements on her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for the next crop.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Paulino de 22 años quien a corta edad es muy empeñoso, lleva una relación formidable con Luz su pareja, ambos lograron hacer posible la llegada al mundo de su primer hijo Luis de 8 meses, al corto tiempo de llevar una vida independiente se encuentran arrendando una casa de madera. Con el apoyo de su padre logró obtener su propia parcela debido a ser un joven muy trabajador, es así que desde hace 2 años desempeña actividades agropecuarias teniendo como principal actividad la producción de café y cacao debido a su gran demanda, Su gran apoyo luz quien constantemente  apoya en actividades menores hacen que sea un equipo unido frente a la difícil labor que es el campo, que por cierto le agrada mucho.
Al hacer una revisión integra de sus plantaciones se dio con la sorpresa de que existen varios árboles de cacao cuyo periodo de vida ya culmino y es necesario realizar el cambio correspondiente para no desaprovechar espacios reduciendo la capacidad de producción del terreno. Para ello es necesario adquirir almácigos en cantidad así como también injertos, dentro de sus capacidades aprendió la manera de fabricar su propio abono orgánico a base de plantas y  tierra fértil que a futuro piensa también comercializar. Este es su tercer crédito que le permitirá trabajar con mas confianza, pero promete cumplir puntualmente con las cuotas. De la misma forma comenta que le gusta mucho trabajar con sus compañeros de su banco comunal ya que son personas muy responsables.
Con los 500 soles comprará almácigos de cacao e injertos.
texts.en:
Paulino is 22 years old, and in his short life has been very enterprising.  He has a strong relationship with his wife, Luz.  Together, they are raising their eight-month-old son, Luis.  Shortly after they moved out on their own, they started leasing a wooden house.  

With the support of his father, he was able to purchase his own parcel of land.  Since he is a hardworking young man, for the past two years he has been making a living through agriculture - specifically the production of coffee and cocoa - due to its high demand.  Luz, who is a great support to him, is constantly helping him with basic tasks, and they have been a united team in the face of the hard work of the countryside.  He clearly appreciates her very much.

Upon reviewing his land, he was surprised to find that there are a number of cocoa trees at the end of their lifecycle, and it is now necessary to replant the land so that the space is not wasted and the land capacity is maximized.  For this reason, he needs to buy seedlings in bulk quantities, as well as grafts.  Among his skills, he learned to make his own organic fertilizer made of plants and fertile soil, which he is also thinking of selling in the future.

This is his third loan that will allow him to work with more confidence.  He promises to pay off his loans on time.  He also commented that he really enjoys working with his friends from the communal bank and that they are very responsible people.  With the 500 soles (Peruvian money) he will buy cocoa seedlings and grafts.

loans.use: to buy cocoa seedlings and grafts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to resell

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en: Sofia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell at her store. She has been in this business for 30 years, and also earns some additional income from food vending. Sofia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts as well as with the help of her loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell at her general store

loans.name: Ma.fe

texts.en:
Ma.Fe is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more items like laundry soap, snack foods and other groceries for her general store business.

NWTF is presenting Ma.Fe's business for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like laundry soap, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is from San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 33 years old. Fe is married and has two children. To make a living, Fe owns & operates a transportation business.Fe has been engaged in her business for three years and earns 3,600 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Fe joined GDMPC. Fe is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Gloriosa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Gloriosa works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines.  Gloriosa is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

Gloriosa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to  provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.en: Demetrio is married with one kid. He is 47 years old and resides in Camanga, Tukuran. Demetrio raises crops, planting and harvesting rice for sale in the local community to earn a living. He has been three years in this business. Each month, he earns 6,200 PHP from farming. He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Just recently Demetrio joined GDMPC. Demetrio wants to save a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 48 years old and widowed with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Magdalena runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell.

Magdalena has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, bread and soft drinks. 

In the future Magdalena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance of his jeepny.

loans.name: Ma. Nesie

texts.en:
Ma. Nesie is 42 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Nesie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell at her store.

Ma. Nesie has been in this business for 16 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, biscuits, soft drinks and beverages. 

In the future Ma. Nesie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials and paint to finish the house.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo, 32 years old, is a married entrepreneur from Camanga, Tukuran with five children and is earning a living from his rice production business. It has been in operation for almost 10 years now and he earn 5,040 PHP a month. To improve his business, he is borrowing the amount of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC micro-credit which he joined in 2011 in order to purchase fertilizer. Before long, he’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn works hard to support her family. Jovelyn is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Jovelyn requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell. She has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Jovelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 54 years old and married with five children. She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Estrella requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Estrella has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF and more recently from Kiva, to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Elba Rosa

texts.es: Cliente microempresaria de 48 años madre soltera con dos hijos que le ayudan a  la administración de su pulpería que tiene ubicada en su domicilio,  de estar en la institución lleva más de 4 años y el  crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su venta como granos básicos arroz, frijoles, aceite, papel higiénico, jabón de lavar ropa, detergentes variados y de diferentes marcas, embutidos, consomé de pollo, consomé de res, consomé de camarón etc.
texts.en: The client is 48 years old and is a single mother of two children, who help her with her grocery store, which is located in her home.  She has been making a living this way for more than four years and she will invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise for sale.  She will buy such staple items such as rice, beans, cooking oil, toilet paper, laundry detergents of different types and brands, sausages, chicken broth, beef stock, shrimp stock, etc.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, laundry detergent, dish soap, etc.

loans.name: Victoriana Del Carmen

texts.es: Victoriana, 54 años de edad, madre de dos hijos, originaria de San Juan de Limay  municipio de Estelí. Se dedica al comercio, es dueña de una pulpería, donde vende productos comestibles por unidad, en esa zona son pocos los comerciantes y no hay muchas pulperías cerca así que es un buen punto para vender. Ella necesita el crédito para comprar granos básicos, aceite, productos de limpieza, salsas, enlatados, jugo, gaseosas, medicinas caceras. Todos productos de gran demanda y necesidad entre su clientela. Ella desea convertir su pequeño negocio en una miscelánea bien surtida de productos comestibles.
texts.en:
Victoriana is 54 years old and the mother of 2 children. She came from San Juan de Limay in Esteli municipality. Victoriana is a merchant, the owner of a general store where she sells foodstuffs at retail. In this zone there are few commercial establishments and few general stores nearby, so this is a good location to sell. 

Victoriana needs a loan to buy basic grains, cooking oil, cleaning products, sauces, canned goods, juice, soft drinks, and household medicines. All these products are in great demand and needed by her customers. She wants to convert her small business into a well supplied grocery store.

loans.use: purchase basic grains, cooking oil, cleaning products, sauces, canned goods, juice, soft drinks, and household medicines to sell.

loans.name: Elio Alfredo

texts.es:
Elio, es un humilde carpintero, originario de Estelí, tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad, su esposa es ama de casa, siendo el único que sostiene a la familia. El inicio a trabajar desde los 15 años de edad en el taller de su primo fue donde adquirió experiencia y decidió poner su propio taller, poco a poco fue ahorrando hasta lograrlo establecer, elabora puertas, ventanas, gabinetes, sillas, mesas. 
Él está requiriendo un crédito para comprar barniz, tornillos, clavos, lijas, madera, pegamento, pintura. Pues tiene pedido que entregar y necesita materia prima para cumplirle a sus clientes. Su proyecto futuro es darle una buena educación a su hijo y ampliar más su taller de carpintería, dar trabajo a más personas.
texts.en:
Elio is a humble carpenter, originally from Esteli. He has one 6-year-old son.  His wife is a homemaker, making him the only one who supports the family. He began to work when he was 15 years old. It was in his cousin’s workshop that he acquired experience and decided to open his own workshop. Little by little he saved until he was able to establish it. He makes doors, windows, cabinets, doors, and tables.

He is requesting the loan to buy varnish, screws, nails, sandpaper, wood, glue, and paint. He has requests to fulfill and he needs raw materials to serve his clients. His future project is to give a good education to his son and expand his carpenter’s workshop, employing more people.

loans.use: to buy varnish, screws, nails, sandpaper, wood, glue, and paint.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es: La Sra.  Leticia tiene 18 años,  se dedica  a la   venta de variedad de ropa de temporada y en esta ocasión se dedica a la variedad de poleras, ella tiene un puesto fijo en localidad de Quillacollo,  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Leticia va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de variedad de  poleras por mayor y de esta manera brindar variedad de ropa  a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio y también que se acerca la época de calor y las poleras tienen mucha demanda, la Sra. Leticia va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de ropa, la Sra. Leticia es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: Leticia is 18 years old. She sells a range of seasonal clothing and is currently selling a variety of t-shirts. She has a permanent market stand in Quillacollo, where she offers her goods. This is her first loan with this institution. Leticia will use the loan to buy wholesale clothing and be able to offer a wider variety of clothing to her customers and increase her profits. She is requesting this loan so she can keep improving her business and because the hot season is coming and t-shirts are in demand. Leticia will use her earnings to keep buying a variety of clothing. She is a hardworking person and is very grateful for the opportunity she's being offered.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is from Tabuan, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 43 years old, married, and has four children. To make a living, Gina operates a general store. She has been in business for three years and earns 6,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Gina joined GDMPC. Gina is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita, age 56, is a widow who operates a sari-sari store as a source of income. She is seeking a loan of PHP 5,000 to use for purchasing additional stock of groceries such as sugar, oil, biscuits and soft drinks. By providing the products her customers request, she will be able to meet their daily necessities, as well as improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries such as sugar, oil, biscuits and soft drinks

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and other goods.

loans.name: Cristian Vitelio

texts.es:
Cristian, vive con su padre y un hermano, él es padre de tres niños de 13, 11 y 7 años, Cristian aprendió por su hermano la venta de pan, compra el pan ya hecho, esta en este negocio desde hace 5 años, con un horario diario de 6:00am a 5:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprarse pan por mayor cantidad, variando los tipos de este producto para seguir comercializando, este financiamiento le ayudara para que Cristian realice una buena compra.
Cristian quiere a través de este préstamo poder mejorar la disponibilidad de pan en el negocio, que le permita seguir generando trabajo para sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Cristian lives with his father and a brother. He is the father of three children aged 13, 11, and 7 years. Cristian learned bread sales from his brother. He buys the bread already made. He has worked in this business for 5 years, with a schedule of 6:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

Now he is applying for a loan to buy bread in larger quantities, varying the types of this product to continue commercializing. This financing will help Cristian to make a good purchase.

Cristian wants through this loan to be able to improve the availability of bread in the store, which allows him to continue generating work for his profits.

loans.use: to buy bread in larger quantities to sell.

loans.name: Hiedeliza

texts.en: Hiedeliza is 41 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Hiedeliza has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Hiedeliza requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more clothing to sell. She has been in this business for four years. In the future, Hiedeliza would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Redalyn

texts.en: As a married parent of two children, Redalyn works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from dried fish vending. Redalyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her fish vending business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is 65 years old and married with five children. Felicitas is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Felicitas requested a 20000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Felicitas has been raising pigs for 13 years now. She has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva, to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 49 years old and married with one child. Sally works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 24000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

Sally has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from farming coconut/dried coconut meat.

Sally aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en:
Fanny is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of rice to sell.

NWTF is relisting Fanny's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en: Anabelle is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business. NWTF is listing Anabelle's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en: Agustina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more rice to sell. NWTF is listing Agustina's business profile for another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

Virginia is borrowing 15000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 10 years. Virginia earns more income from farming rice as well as buying and selling rice grains.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Evagelia

texts.en: Evagelia is a 27-year-old who is married with no children. She plans to start a small elei fabric printing business. Evagelia needs a loan to purchases paint brushes, materials and colored paints for her business. She will use her profits to supply her family with their daily needs. Evagelia joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy paint brushes, fabric and paint

loans.name: Merina

texts.en: Merina is a 36-year-old single woman with 2 children. She makes and sells bakery foods and drinks in her community to earn a living. She has many years of experience with this business. Merina needs a loan to purchase flour, sugar, Kool Aid, donuts, Cream buns and German buns for her business. She plans to use her profits to provide her family with their daily needs.  Merina has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: To pay for flour, sugar, Kool Aid, donuts, cream buns and German buns.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to raise and fatten pigs.

loans.name: Maselina

texts.en:
Maselina is 46 years old and married with 11 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pork cake in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to purchase flour, cooking oil, a big frying pan, soy sauce, and garlic onion for her business. 

In the future, Maselina hopes to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, a big frying pan, soy sauce, and garlic onion.

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en: Katerina is a 31-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Katerina has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, sprayers, and crops. She just joined SPBD this year. With her profits, Katerina hopes to buy her family some new furniture.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals, a wheel barrow, fertilizer, sprayers, and crops

loans.name: Taimoe

texts.en: Taimoe  is a 42-year-old married woman with 8 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for 4 years. Taimoe has requested a loan to buy chemicals, shovels, sprayers, crops, fertilizers, and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. With her profits, Taimoe hopes to get her children into better schools.

loans.use: To buy chemicals, shovels, sprayers, crops, fertilizers, and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Tofu

texts.en:
Tofu is 33 years old and married with two children. She wants to start a small business making and selling banana chips and ice-cakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to purchase sugar, plastic bags, Kool-aid, bananas, cooking oil, and plastic cups for her business.

In the future, Tofu hopes to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to pay for sugar, plastic bags, Kool-aid, bananas, cooking oil, and plastic cups.

loans.name: Eleni

texts.en:
Eleni is 41 years old and married with five children. She runs a small business selling chicken buns in her community and has been doing this for two years. 

Eleni has requested a loan to buy chicken leg quarters, soya sauce, salt, flour, and pots. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Eleni will pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chicken leg quarters, soya sauce, salt, flour, and pots.

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en: Katerina is 23 years old and single with no children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for one year. Katerina has requested a loan to buy fishing nets, bait, hooks, boots, and a fishing boat. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Katerina hope to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, bait, hooks, boots, and a fishing boat (canoe)

loans.name: Matina

texts.en: Matina is 32 years old and married with five children. She owns and operates a business venture sewing clothes for her community. She has many years of experience in this line of business. Matina needs a loan to buy a new sewing machine, fabrics, needles and oil for her business. She hopes to use her profits to help provide her family with their everyday needs. She joined SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, fabrics, needles and oil

loans.name: Freda

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Freda works hard to support her family.

She has a business raising pigs in the Philippines. Freda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Freda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Yina Marciana

texts.es: Yina vive en Guayaquil. Entre risas no cuenta que no se ha casado porque aun no conoce a su príncipe azul. Vive con sus padres ya que su economía no le permite comprar una casa propia. El negocio lo aprendió de sus padres quienes se dedicaban a esta actividad, luego decidió independizarse con la venta de choclo y verde. Luego con la ayuda de sus hermanas empezaron la venta de humitas y bollos y meriendas. Ahora tiene un pequeño bar con mucha clientela ya que sus productos gustan mucho. Yina nos informa que el sector es peligroso la delincuencia la cual si le preocupa. Su meta futura es comprar su casa con un local para no tener que alquilar y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Yina lives in Guayaquil. Laughing, she tells us that she has not married because she hasn't yet met her prince charming. She lives with her parents, since her finances do not allow her to buy her own house. She learned her business from her parents, who worked in this business, then she decided to become independent, selling corn and greens. Then, with the help of her sisters, they began selling humitas (flavored corn paste wrapped in corn husks), rolls, and snacks. Now she has a little bar with many customers, since they like her products a lot. Yina tells us that the area is dangerous and she worries about crime. Her goals for the future are to buy a house with commercial space so that she doesn't have to rent and to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy a commercial space so that she doesn't have to rent and to buy supplies in general

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 19 años, se considera una persona alegre cariñosa, responsable, solidaria y luchadora. Sandra vive con sus padres cerca de San gabriel.

Sandra tiene un puesto de venta de frutas y legumbres, este negocio lo tiene un año y ha sido de gran ayuda para los gastos de sus estudios y de su hogar, Sandra es una chica emprendedora y sueña en tener su propio micromercado para incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida, es por eso que poco a poco va incrementando sus productos y sus ventas, actualmente solicita un crédito a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de naranjas, sandías, mandarinas, uvas y también necesita comprar bandejas para exibirlos.
texts.en:
Sandra is 19 years old.  She is a caring, joyful, responsible, supportive, and determined person.  Sandra lives with her parents near San Gabriel.  Sandra has a stand selling fruits and vegetables.  

She has had this business for a year and it has been a great help for her school and household expenses.  Sandra is an enterprising young woman and she dreams of having her own mini-market to increase her income and improve her quality of life.  It is because of this that, little by little, she is increasing her products and her sales.  Currently, she is requesting a loan from Fodemi that she will invest in the purchase of oranges, watermelons, mandarin oranges, grapes, and she also needs to purchase trays to display them.

loans.use: to expand her business with the purchase of oranges, watermelons, mandarin oranges, grapes, as well as trays to display them.

loans.name: Meki

texts.en: Meki is 32 years old and married with three children. She owns and operates a small store selling general stock. She has been doing this for three years. Meki needs a loan to buy soft drinks, onions, mosquito coils, snacks, and cooking oil. She hopes to use her profits to expand and renew her shop in the future. She became a member of SPBD this year to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, onions, mosquito coils, snacks, and cooking oil

loans.name: Aiga

texts.en: Aiga is 63 years old and married with seven children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for three years. Aiga has requested a loan to buy cooking oil, pots, flour, sugar, and an oven. She joined SPBD to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Aiga will help with her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, pots, flour, sugar, and an oven,.

loans.name: Uriel

texts.es: Uriel, es agricultor de la zona Llamada La Quinta, en las afueras de Estelí, siembra papas, chiltomas y repollo. Inicio su actividad hace 10 años , en las tierras que su papa le dejo de herencia, el lugar es muy fértil además que cuenta con recursos hídricos que facilitan el sistema de riego para los cultivos, su esposa es ama de casa pero también le ayuda a sembrar, mientras sus hijos estudian la secundaria. El necesita un financiamiento Kiva para comprar insumos y pagar mano de obra para sembrar ½ manzana de Papas. Esto le permitirá darle una mejor asistencia a sus cultivos. Uno de sus proyectos es comprar 1 manzana de tierra y diversificar sus cultivos.
texts.en: Uriel is a farmer from the zone called La Quinta, on the outskirts of Estelí. He plants potatoes, peppers, and cabbages. He began this work 10 years ago on the lands that his father left him as an inheritance. The location is very fertile. In addition he has water resources that supply the irrigation system for the crops. His wife is a homemaker, but she also helps him plant, while his children attend secondary school. He needs a Kiva loan to buy supplies and pay for labor to plant half a manzana (about 0.86 acres) of potatoes. This will allow him to give better care to his crops. One of his projects is to buy one manzana (1.7 acres) of land and diversify his crops.

loans.use: to buy supplies and pay for labor to plant 1/2 manzana of potatoes

loans.name: Ulaula

texts.en:
Ulaula is a 30-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and breadfruit to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. With her profits, Ulaula hopes to renew her house.

Ulaula has requested a loan to pay for her children's education. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
Vivencia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Vivencia has been in this business for four years and earns more income from fishing.

She is borrowing 10000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell for her dried fish vending business.

Vivencia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Lealo

texts.en: Lealo is 32 years old and single with 1 child. She wants to start a small business making and selling ice-cakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to purchases a fridge, sugar, plastic bags, a cooler and cool aid for her business. In the future, Lealo hopes to save more and earn more from her business to help her family's everyday needs. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make ice cakes for sale

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Irene works hard to support her family.  She has a vegetable farming business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tricycle transportation and hog raising. Irene is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and a variety of seedlings.

Irene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a balut vending business in the Philippines.   She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy more eggs to make balut.

NWTF is relisting Josefina's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: buy eggs to make balut

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en:
Elisapeta  is 25 years old and married with 2 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Elisapeta needs a loan to buy mutton flaps, rice, onions, curry, and soft drinks to sell. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: buy products to sell in her store

loans.name: Senia

texts.en:
Senia is 58 years old and married with 6 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling different merchandise in her community. She has been doing this for many years. 

Senia needs a loan to purchase flour, sugar, salt, softdrinks, soaps, washing powder, vailima beers, cigarettes and a box of chickens for her store. She hopes to use her profits to provide her family a good living condition. She became a member of SPBD in 2008 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: buy items to sell in her store

loans.name: Mylen

texts.en:
Mylen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business raising pigs in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

NWTF is presenting Mylen's business profile for another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for pigs.

loans.name: Sara Esmeralda

texts.es:
Sara, necesita incrementar su negocio y poder tener más inventario, es por eso que está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de productos básicos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijol, galletas, etc. Para así mejor su condición económica mediante el fortalecimiento del negocio.
Ella considera que con su préstamo anterior pudo mejorar la calidad de su negocio, ha mejorado en las ventas diarias y en la familia todo se mantiene de la misma forma, sin haber presentado inconvenientes.
texts.en: Sara needs to increase her business and be able to have more inventory. This is why she is applying for a new loan to buy basic products such as rice, sugar, oil, beans, crackers, etc., to thus improve her economic condition by strengthening the business. She judges that her previous loan was able to improve the quality of her business. She has improved her daily sales, and in the family everything remains the same, without any difficulties.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, beans, and crackers to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Lorna works hard to support her family.   She has a business raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tailoring. 

Lorna is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.  Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ana Marie works hard to support her family.  She has a frozen food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.   Ana Marie is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional products to sell for her frozen food vending business.

Ana Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy frozen food to sell

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a metal shop business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her metal shop business.

NWTF is relisting Lina's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy metal shop tools and equipment

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is a 24-year-old lady from Nyalenda Kisumu. She is married to Maurice and they have a four-year-old child.

Roseline operates a small fish selling business where she sells a fish locally known as omena. She has been operating the business for the last five years and makes a monthly income of 10,000 KES. 

She is now taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy stocks of small fish to sell. Her profits will be used to improve her family's living standards. Her dream is to expand her fish selling business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of small fish to sell.

loans.name: Potoae

texts.en:
Potoae is 40 years old and married with six children. She runs a small business selling food in her community and has been doing this for three years. 

Potoae has requested a loan to buy snacks, drinks, a gas oven, foam cups, spoons, and forks for her business. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to capital.

With her earnings, Potoae will help with her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy snacks, drinks, a gas oven, foam cups, spoons, and forks.

loans.name: Syahrul

texts.en:
Pak Syahrul has worked for Ruma since May 2011 as Ruma’s Field Officer. However, he joined Ruma before that as a Ruma business partner by selling Ruma’s airtime products in Cibubur area. As a field officer, he works mostly in the field to introduce Ruma’s products and recruit new business partners. He reports directly to Cibubur’s branch head. He enjoys working with Ruma because it help him to develop his abilities and support the business in rural areas.
 
As a branch head in Bogor Selatan, Pak Syahrul needs a motorcycle to help him run the day-to-day tasks of a branch head. This motorcycle will not only help him to improve the Bogor Barat branch but also to control and monitor his staffs, and to find a good and prospective business partner that will help to have sustained business with Ruma.

Currently, although Pak Syahrul  lives on a daily basis in Bogor Selatan, his family (wife and two children) is still living in Cibubur and runs the shops selling airtime and some groceries products.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina is a 32-year-old woman who is married with four children. She has a taxi that helps earn income for her family. She has three years in this business. Tina needs a loan to buy spare parts for her taxi. She will use her profits to pay her children's school fees. Tina joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy oil, brakes, new tires, and seat covers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Malaea

texts.en:
Malaea is 38 years old and married with four children. She owns and operates a business venture, selling different merchandise in her community. She has many years of experience in this line of business. 

Malaea needs a loan to pay for bags of rice, sugar, salt, toilet paper, snacks, soft drinks, noodles, and mosquito coils. 

She hopes to use the profits of her business to help pay for her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to pay for bags of rice, sugar, salt, toilet paper, snacks, soft drinks, noodles, and mosquito coils.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Nilda works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Nilda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of clothing to sell to her customers.

Nilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing for resale.

loans.name: Luse

texts.en: Luse is a 56-year-old woman who is married with eight children. She runs a business selling printed clothes in her community. She has five years of experience with this business. Luse has requested a loan to buy materials and clothes for her business. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and to save some for her children education. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy clothes, fabric, threads, and needles for her business

loans.name: Losivale

texts.en:
Losivale is a 45-year-old married woman with six children.

She would like to start growing crops of taro and bananas to earn a living. Losivale has requested a loan to buy new equipment for her business. 

She has been a member of SPBD for less than a year. Losivale will spend her profits to help pay her children's education expenses and on everyday family needs.

loans.use: to pay for supplies such as grass-sprayer, chemicals, knife, and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma works hard to support her family. Emma is widow and has a business selling dry goods in the Philippines.

Emma requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Emma has been in this business for 22 years now.

In the future, Emma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional dry goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Tapunuu

texts.en: Tapunuu is 48-years-old and married with 6 children.  She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community.  To do this, she needs a loan to buy tools and everything she needs for her business.  In the future, Tapunuu hopes to expand her business.  She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy items for a new pancake business (cooking oil, flour, sugar, new frying pan).

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 39 years old and married with three children.

Rowena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her store.

Rowena has been in this business for five years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Rowena aspires to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Maiseava

texts.en: Maiseava is a 54-year-old widow with 2 children.  She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as sugar, salt, flour etc.  She has been doing this for many years.  Maiseava needs a loan to purchase more goods to restock her business.  She hopes to use her profits to provide her family with everyday needs and to expand her business.  She became a member of SPBD in 2008 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase items for her store (sacks of flour, sugar, salt, snacks, soaps, mutton flaps, chicken leg quarters, etc.).

loans.name: Tepora

texts.en: Tepora is a 56-year-old married woman with 6 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and banana trees to earn a living. She has been doing this for 4 years. Tepora has requested a loan to buy chemicals, weedkiller, shovels, gloves, and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. With her profits, Tepora hopes to expand her business and to plan another business in the future.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weedkiller, shovels, gloves, and a wheelbarrow.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Renea

texts.en:
Renea is 38 years old and married with three children.

Renea works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell.

Renea has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Renea aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 45 years old and married with four children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for 5 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Josephine aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Iloga

texts.en:
Iloga is a 65-year-old married woman with eight children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu and such crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. 

Iloga has requested a loan to renew her home. She will use the loan to pay for timber, cement, bricks, iron roof, and ceiling and other materials for her home improvement. She has been a member of SPBD since 2007. With her profits, Iloga hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to pay for timber, cement, bricks, iron roof, and ceiling materials for her home improvement.

loans.name: Elieta

texts.en: Elieta is 37 years old and married with 8 children. She runs a small business selling keke puaa (Samoan pork buns) in her community and has been doing this for 3 years. Elieta has requested a loan to improve her home condition. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Elieta will continue her business to earn more.

loans.use: to pay for timber, cement, bricks, an iron roof etc for her home improvement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, weedkiller, sprayers, gloves, and bush knives.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction) in the Philippines. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell at her nipa business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of nipa (woven palm mats) to sell

loans.name: Sari Kencana Group

texts.en:
With her last loan, Jro Nyoman managed to get a profit of 750,000 IDR.  This is very helpful to the family's finances as they are currently experiencing difficult times due to the increasingly expensive necessities of life.  Jro Nyoman, with the Sari Kencana Group, decided to continue lending from the MUK due to their help in developing pigs businesses.  This loan will be used to buy 2 piglets and pig feed.  She hopes this business can support her children’s education.

Jro Nyoman is holding the yellow map.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and 2 superior piglets for fattening.

loans.name: Tile

texts.en:
Tile is 29 years old and married with two children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for three years.

Tile has requested a loan to buy more goods for her business and for her home improvement. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tile will try to save more in order to improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: to pay for goods including flour, oil and oven gas, as well as timber, cement, hammer and nails

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy equipments and to buy taro plants, chemicals, weed killer, sprayers, bush knives

loans.name: Eve

texts.en: Eve is a 69-year-old widow with 4 children. She runs a small business selling keke puaa (Samoan pork buns) in her community and has been doing this for 3 years. Eve has requested a loan to improve her home condition and children's education. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Eve will try and save some on the side in order to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for timber, cement, bricks, and an iron roof

loans.name: Kenneth Eduardo

texts.es: Kenneth, 25 años, soltero, se dedica a vender repuestos de moto y carro. El estudio Ingeniería en sistema pero la escasez de trabajo lo obligo a buscar otras formas de sobrevivir aunque  no fuera en su carrera. Su padre lo apoyo desde el principio, tiene un año de administrar el negocio. Él está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar repuestos como manecillas, pie de vía, conos, focos, luces. La circulación de motos ha aumento al igual que la demanda de repuestos. Su objetivo es lograr surtir más su negocio y tener lo último y moderno en equipos para moto y carro.
texts.en: Kenneth, is 25 years old and single.  He works selling spare car and motorcycle parts.  He studied systems engineering, but the scarcity of emplyment forced him to look for other ways to make a living even though it was outside of his career.  His father has supported him from the beginning.  He has been managing this business for a year.  He requires financing in order to purchase spare parts such as turn signal handles, gear shifts, traffic pylons, light bulbs, headlights and tail lights.  The popularity of motorcycles has increased and with it the demand for spare parts.  His goal is to be able to stock his business and to have the latest and most modern equipment for motorcycles and cars.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts such as turn signal handles, gear shifts, traffic pylons, light bulbs, headlights, and tail lights.

loans.name: Fale

texts.en:
Fale is a 25-year-old married woman with 1 child. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for 4 years. 

Fale has requested a loan to buy shovels, chemicals, crops, and a wheelbarrow.
 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. With her profits, Fale hopes to buy some new furniture.

loans.use: to buy shovels, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, and crops

loans.name: Siline

texts.en:
Siline is a 53-year-old married woman with eight children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for 6 years. 

Siline has requested a loan to buy more chemicals, sprayers, gloves, boots and crops. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. With her profits, Siline hopes to pay for her childrens school fees.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, sprayers, gloves, boots, and crops

loans.name: Isu

texts.en:
Isu is a 28-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and ta'amu (giant taro) to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Isu has requested a loan to purchase new equipment in order to improve her farming business, and also to purchase timber, cement, and other items to improve her house.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. With her profits, Isu hopes to expand her business in order for her to earn more.

loans.use: to pay for timber, iron roof, cement, wheelbarrow, grass sprayer, etc.

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es: La Sra. Zenobia  sigue con la misma actividad de tienda de barrio, ciuenta que con el anterior credito le fue muy bien y que pudo durtir su tienda, en esta ocacion solicita el credito para la compra de dulces y refrescos, abarrotes y  para compra de varios productos, y así de esta manera seguir incrementando su capital,  La Sra. Zenobia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son competencia de otras tiendas. Ella va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de  mercadería la Sra. Zenobia  sueña con  ampliar su negocio, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Zenobia continues to manage a neighborhood store. She did very well with her previous loan and was able to restock her store.

On this occasion she is requesting a loan in order to buy candy, soft drinks, groceries, and various other products. This will enable her to continue increasing her capital. Sra. Zenobia faces challenges in her business, such as competition from other stores. She will utilize the benefits of this loan to buy merchandise.

Sra. Zenobia dreams of expanding her business. She is pleased and grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to buy candy, soft drinks, groceries, and various other products.

loans.name: Murtazo

texts.ru: Муртазо родился в 1967 году. Женат имеет троих  детей.  Он работает таксистом уже 10 лет.  Это является его единственным доходом.  Его старая автомашина уже не исправна но чтобы купить новую у него не хватает денежных средств, поэтому Муртазо   обратился в нашу организацию за кредитом. Он планирует на полученный кредит  купить новую автомашину.  Он очень благодарен Арванду, за то, что его поддерживают   в трудную минуту.
texts.en: Murtazo was born in 1983. He is married and has three children. Murtazo has been working as a taxi driver for ten years and this is the sole source of income for his family. His old taxi cab is in bad shape but Murtazo doesn't have enough savings to purchase a new vehicle.He has turned to KIVA for a loan which he will use to purchase a new taxi cab. Murtazo is very grateful to Arvand for their support during this difficult time.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Daler

texts.ru:
Далер проживает в городе Душанбе. Ему 24 года. Он холост. Далер живет с родителями. Его мать занимается торговлей. Сам Далер работает таксистом. Он занимается развозками пассажиров и перевозками по городу. В этой области Далер шесть лет. 
Далер берет кредит для того чтобы оплатить оставшиеся деньги за приобретенную новую автомашину.
texts.en: Daler lives in Dushanbe. He is 24 years old and single. Daler lives with his parents. His mother works in retail and Daler works as a taxi driver. He offers shuttle services and deliveries within city limits. Daler has had his taxi business for six years. Daler is taking out this loan to pay back his debt for purchasing a car.

loans.use: to pay back a loan he took out to purchase a car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Tumema

texts.en: Tumema is 60 years old and married with 5 children. She runs a small business selling ice-cake in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Tumema has requested a loan to buy cordials, sugar, large spoon, and foam cups. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tumema will help with her families expenses.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, large spoons, and foam cups

loans.name: Jaliya

texts.en:
Jaliya is a 38-year-old mother of 1 child. Her child is 15 years old and goes to school.

She has been selling clothes for the last 22 years and also has some cows and bananas she tends to on a small farm. Right now Jaliya sells her clothes on the ground in the market but in the future she wants to rent a big shop to sell them from. Her biggest challenge is competition from other people selling clothes in the market. With her profits from the business she sends her child to school.

loans.use: To buy more women's clothes to sell

loans.name: Edis Alberto

texts.es:
Edis, necesita aplicarle fertilizantes a su siembra de maíz y yuca, es por eso que está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de dichos abonos y herbicidas, esto le ayudara a mejorar su cosecha fortaleciendo la platacion para que esta se encuentre libre de plagas y sea mas abundante la cosecha.
El comenta que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a mejorar la cosecha pasada, con mejores resultados en la produccion, pudo sembrar 3 metros más de terreno de yuca, gracias a ello han podido incrementar su economía.
texts.en:
Edis needs a loan so that he can apply fertilizers to his corn and cassava crops. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can buy compost and herbicides. This will help him improve his crops and strengthen his plantings to keep them free of pests and to achieve a more abundant harvest.

Edis says that his previous loan helped him improve his last harvest. He attained better production results as a result of planting an additional three square meters of land with cassava. Thanks to his efforts, he has been able to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy compost and herbicides.

loans.name: Savalii

texts.en: Savali is 64 years old and a widow with 8 children. She runs a small business selling keke-puaa (pork bun) in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Savali has requested a loan to not only to improve her business, but do some repairs on her home as well. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Savali will help provide for her children education and her family daily need.

loans.use: to pay for timber, cement, bricks, iron roof, oil, pots, cooking utensils, flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for repairing the kitchen in her home.

loans.name: Kuymurod

texts.ru: Куймурод мужчина, в возрасте 23 лет, женат, пока  не имеет детей.  Куймурод уже в течение 10 лет занимается откармливанием крупно рогатого  скота.  За этот период он достиг много положительного результата.  Жена Куймурода в свободное время  помогает откармливанием скота дома. Он уже два года кредитуется в нашей организации.  В течение 2 лет не разу не нарушал политику организации и своевременно погашал свой полученный кредит. Куймурод ответственный, пунктуальный и честный человек. Он благодарен  таким организациям как Арванд за поддержку и понимание. На  полученный кредит Куймурод хочет расширить  свой бизнес в сфере животноводство и купить крупно рогатый скот.
texts.en: Kuymurod is a 23 year old married man without children. For the last 10 years Kuymurod has been raising cattle for resale and has reached many business milestones during this time. Kuymurod's wife helps feed the animals in her spare time. Kuymurod has been receiving loans from our organization for two years. He is responsible, punctual and honest man. He is grateful to organizations like Arvand for their support and understanding. Kuymurod is planning to use this loan to expand his cattle business and purchase more animals for his herd.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Vaydullo

texts.ru: Вайдулло мужчина в возрасти 50 лет, женат, имеет троих детей.   В течение  уже 30 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур.   Он выращивает лук, пшеницу, кукурузу и другие сельскохозяйственной культуры. Кроме этого Вайдулло занимается откармливанием  крупно рогатого и мелко рогатого скота в этом ему помогает его жена.   Вайдулло очень старательный и добросовестный человек. Он старается чтобы его дети нормально жили а внуки  учились в высших учебных заведениях.   Вайдулло кредитуется в ООО МДО «Арванд» несколько лет, не разу не нарушал политику кредитования.   На полученный кредит  Вайдулло хочет  приобрести несколько голов скота.    Он очень благодарен  таким организациям как Арванд.
texts.en: Vaydullo is 50 years old, married and a father of three children. For the last 30 years Vaydullo has been working as a farmer. He grows onions, wheat, corn and other crops. He also raises livestock, a business which his wife helps him with. Vaydullo is a hardworking and conscientious man. He wants to make sure that his children have a good life and that his grandchildren will be able to attend university. Vaydullo has been taking out loans with "Arvand" for several years and has never broken the lending agreement. He is planning to use the current loan to purchase additional livestock. He is very grateful to organizations like Arvand.

loans.use: purchase livestock

loans.name: Rahim

texts.ru: Рахим мужчина в возрасте. Он с 2010 года является нашим клиентам.  Он женат и имеет  троих детей.  Их семья  очень дружная и счастливая.  Его жена домохозяйка но в свободное время помогает мужу по откармливанию скота.  Сам Рахим  работает   врачом в своем кишлаке но  заработная плата очень маленькая. У них хороший  доход   от животноводство. Поэтому они стараются развивать этот бизнес. Рахим  на полученный кредит  хочет купить несколько голов скота. Заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и понимание.
texts.en: Rahim is an older man. He has been our client since 2010. Rahim is married and a father of three children. His family is a happy one. Rahim's wife is a home maker but helps her husband on the farm in her spare time. Rahim is the village's doctor but his salary is very small. However, the family makes a good living selling cattle and they want to further develop this business. Rahim is very grateful for your support and understanding.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
Simón tiene 40 años de edad, casado, con 01 hijo dependiente de 02 años, vive en casa propia en el Caserío Chepito Olivos, ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Mórrope. Perteneciente al departamento de Lambayeque.

La actividad que realiza Simón, es la crianza y venta de animales, cliente cría mayormente ovejos y aves de corral. Los alimenta con pastos naturales, maíz, purina y otros. Simón cría sus animales en corrales hechos de caña, tablas y adobe, quincenalmente los negocia en mercados de Chiclayo.  Paralelamente, se desempeña como agricultor, tiene sembrado maíz en terreno de su señora madre.

Simón desea comprar alimento para su ganado, así como para comprar fertilizantes para su cultivo.  Es por eso que ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Simón is 40 years old, married, and has a two-year-old child who is dependent on him. He lives in his own home in the village of Chepito Olivos, which is located 30 minutes away from the city of Mórrope in the Department of Lambayeque.

Simón’s business involves raising and selling animals. He raises mostly sheep and chickens. The food they eat consists of natural grasses, corn, Purina feed, and other items. Simón raises his animals in pens made of reeds, wooden planks, and adobe. The animals are sold every two weeks at the markets in Chiclayo. He also works as a farmer, planting corn on his mother’s land.

Simón wants to buy feed for his livestock as well as fertilizers for his crops. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 2,000 PEN.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.ru: Абдулло более 35 лет работает учителем. Он проживает в городе Дангара. Абдулло женат. Ему 59 лет. У него пятеро детей, одна девочка и четверо парней. Его жена вместе с дочерью занимаются домашним хозяйством. Старший сын Абдуллы агроном, второй в армии, третий студент а младший учится в средней школе. Абдулло два года как совмещает преподавание с торговлей. Он занимается торговлей. Абдулло рядом с домом открыл магазин со смешанным ассортиментом товара. Он берет кредит для покупки продуктов с целью увеличения оборота.
texts.en: Abdullo has worked as a teacher for 35 years. He is a 59 year old resident of Dangara. Abdullos is married and a father of five children: one daughter and four sons. His wife and daughter take care of the home. Abdullo's eldest son works as an agronomist, the second one is in the army, the third one is a college  student and the youngest is still in school. For the last two years Abdullo has been combining teaching with running a business. Abdullo opened a grocery store next to his house which offers a variety for goods for sale. he is taking out this loan to purchase more groceries so that he can expand his inventory and increase goods turnover.

loans.use: to purchase groceries

loans.name: Sulimauga

texts.en: Sulimauga is 50 years old and married with 4 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as soft drinks, sugar, cigarettes, flour, onions etc. She has been doing this for 4 years. Sulimauga needs a loan to buy soft drinks, noodles, onions, cigarettes, and canned food her shop. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her children's school fees. She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, noodles, onions, cigarettes and canned food

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
María, desea comprar dos cerdos y todo lo necesario para su mantenimiento, es por eso que ella está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de los cerdos, maíz, maicillo y concentrado, en general todo lo que necesite para su engorde, esto le ayudara a mejorar sus ganancias y mejorar su estabilidad en la granja.

Ella manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior, le ayudo en la compra de cerdos, ademas realizo una siembra de maíz y gracias a ello se ha podido mantener económicamente y también a su familia.
texts.en:
María wants to buy two pigs and everything she needs to raise them. For this reason, she is requesting a new loan to buy pigs, corn, sorghum, and concentrated feed. In general, this is everything she needs to fatten them. These pigs will help improve her earnings and the stability of her farm.

María says that her previous loan helped her to buy pigs and plant a crop of corn. As a result, she has been able to maintain her finances and also support her family.

loans.use: to buy two pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Jaime Nolberto

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 48 años de edad, es separado y tiene 02 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el Caserío Pueblo Libre en el Distrito de Tambogrande. Cliente vive en la parte rural del distrito y no cuenta con los servicios básicos.

La actividad que desarrolla Jaime, es el servicio de moto lineal, transportando pasajeros por los diferentes caseríos del valle. Cuenta con más de 03 años de experiencia. Complementariamente cría ganado ovino el cual al alcanzar peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en el mercado de la zona.   Con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades cubre sus gastos y los de su familia.

Jaime busca siempre incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Es por ello que con ese afán ha decidido comprarse una moto lineal y ha solicitado un préstamo de 1200 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Jaime is 48 years old, separated from his spouse, and has two children under his care. He lives in his own home located in the village of Pueblo Libre in the District of Tambogrande. Jaime lives in the rural part of the district and does not receive basic services.

Jaime’s business involves providing off-road motorcycle services. He transports passengers to different villages within the valley. Jaime has more than three years of experience. At the same, he raises sheep until they reach the ideal size and weight before selling them at the local market. With the income he generates from his business activities, Jaime is able to cover the expenses for himself and his family.

He is always looking for ways to increase his income and improve his quality of life. For this reason, Jaime decided that he should buy an off-road motorcycle. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of 1,200 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy an off-road motorcycle.

loans.name: Rosa Imelda

texts.es:
Rosa, tiene la necesidad de mas capital de trabajo en su negocio de meriendas, es por eso que nuevamente está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de leña, maíz, aceite, gas y otros, esto le permitirá seguir con su negocio y mejorar su clientela.
Ella comenta que con los créditos anteriores a seguido creciendo en el negocio, ella sigue con su venta no tiene mayores problemas y sus ganancias han mejorado.
texts.en:
Rosa needs more operating capital for her snack business. For this reason, she is requesting a new loan so that she can buy firewood, corn, oil, gas, and other supplies. This will enable her to continue her business and improve her clientele.

Rosa says that her previous loans allowed her to grow her business. She continues to make sales without any major problems. As a result, her earnings have improved.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, oil, gas, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries to stock his store.

loans.name: Leuma

texts.en: Leuma is 56 years old and married with seven children. She runs a small business selling keke puaa (steamed pork buns) in her community and has been doing this for two years. Leuma has requested a loan to purchase more supplies for her business. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Leuma will continue her business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for supplies such as flour, sugar, salt, onions, soy sauce and a gas oven

loans.name: Fegauiai

texts.en:
Fegauiai is 31 years old and married with 5 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as soft drinks, snacks, canned food, noodles, and flour. She has been doing this for 1 year. 

Fegauiai needs a loan to buy soft drinks, snacks, canned food, noodles, flour and sugar for her shop. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her childrens' education. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, snacks, canned food, noodles, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en: Mwanamkasi has been selling seafood for approximately seven years. She started out working as a farmer but then decided to establish her own business selling fish. Mwanamkasi gradually grew her business and has built up a good clientele over many years. She wakes up at 6:00 A.M. and heads to the docks where the fishing boats arrive. She is a married woman with four grown children. With this loan, she wants to buy fish, a frying pan, and cooking oil. Among her goals are to grow her business, to have enough capital to start another business, and to have another source of income.

loans.use: to buy fish, a frying pan, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Kuini

texts.en: Kuini is 42 years old and married with three children. She wants to start a small business making and selling handy crafts in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy tools and wood supplies. In the future, Kuini hopes to expand her business and to save more money for her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to its financial services.

loans.use: to buy wood, coconut shells and a sharpener for her craft business

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en: Filipina is 25 years old and married, with no children. She has a small garden where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. Filipina needs a loan to buy equipment, chemicals and fertilizer. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Filipina will use the profits from her sales to expand her business and to save some more money for her children's education in the future.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizers, weed killer and bush knives for her business.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan sells fish as a means of generating income for himself. Hassan, 32, lives in Msambweni, a town on the south coast of Kenya. Hassan delivers fish to his existing customers. One of the problems that he faces is seasonality, since some fish become scarce at some periods. He has been fishing for the past 12 years and has gained a lot of experience.

With this loan, Hassan will buy more fishing nets. Among his goals are to grow his business and to open a fish depot in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fishing nets.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 53 years old, married, and has four children.

Nancy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional snack foods, noodles and other grocery items to sell.

Nancy has been in this business for 11 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Nancy aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional snack foods, noodles and other grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Edjromede 4 Group

texts.fr: EDJROMEDE 4 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, Ahinadjè (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Isidore. Le couple a six enfants dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Ahinadjè et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Ahinadjè n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a dix neuf années environs que Ahinadjè mène comme activité la vente de glacières à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Ahinadjè prépare de la nourriture (riz accompagné de sauce), qu'elle vend à son domicile. Ahinadjè exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Ahinadjè s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Ahinadjè sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe EDJROMEDE 4. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur activité et à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle.
texts.en: EDJROMEDE 4 is a group of three people whose members belong to the same savings group.  The representative of the group, Ahinadje (with her hand raised in the photo) is 37-years old and married to a chauffeur named Isidore.  The couple have six dependent children, some of which attend school.  Ahinadje and her husband live together with their children and they take care of the different household expenses together.  Ahinadje did not attend school.  About nineteen years ago, she started selling ice chests from home.  Parallel to this business, she prepares food (rice with sauce) that she sells from home.  Ahinadje is passionate about her business which enables her to take care of her needs and those of her children.  Ahinadje stocks up at a market in Benin. In pursuit of customer satisfaction, Ahinadje is asking for a first loan with the other members of Edjromede 4. This loan will allow them to strengthen their business and better respond to customer demand.

loans.use: to buy two bags of rice, condiments, and ice chests.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 53 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family.
 
Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 23,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase bread, sugar, shampoo and other miscellaneous items.

She has been in this business for 10 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bread, sugar, shampoo and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn previously accessed an 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan that she used to purchase products for her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in the family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

Evelyn would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan for her to buy more products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available, the better her profits will be. These earnings will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this assistance with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Evelyn hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a high quality education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship co-members* to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
